title: Financial Analyst
description:
Are you ready to take on a pivotal role as a Financial Analyst, serving as the right hand to a Fractional CFO revolutionizing the construction and trades industry? Our company stands at the forefront of innovation, specializing in delivering unparalleled CFO services, accounting packages, and offshore staffing solutions tailored specifically for painting companies. As we chart a trajectory towards emphasizing offshore staffing services, we're seeking an enthusiastic and proactive individual to join our dynamic team.

In this unique opportunity, you'll work alongside a trailblazing CEO renowned for her expertise in a traditionally male-dominated field. With over 18 years of experience as an operator of a multi-location commercial painting company, she has cultivated a reputation for excellence, serving on multiple industry boards and sharing her knowledge through non-profit endeavors.
Ideal candidates for this role are passionate about data visualization and modeling, constantly seeking out the latest innovations and approaches to their work. You thrive in an environment where your contributions are recognized and valued, prioritizing meaningful work over mere volume production. Your enthusiasm for Concierge Financials & Accounting, coupled with a deep commitment to client satisfaction, sets you apart.

As a Financial Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the financial sustainability of our organization. From budgeting and forecasting to reporting and analysis, you'll collaborate closely with the President and operations team to drive strategic initiatives and optimize financial performance. Your ability to synthesize complex financial data into actionable insights will be crucial in guiding our organizational growth.

If you're ready to transition from the confines of corporate bureaucracy to a role where your contributions truly make a difference, join us on this exciting journey towards redefining excellence in the construction and trades industry. Apply now and become an integral part of our innovative team, where collaboration, quick thinking, and a passion for organizational growth are celebrated.

This role is 100% work from home.
Schedule:
8AM - 5PM (EST) Monday - Friday

JOB OVERVIEW

The Financial Analyst will play a crucial role in ensuring the organization's financial sustainability by efficiently managing day-to-day financial operations, including financial reporting, modeling, projections, analysis, and compliance. This position involves providing analytical support for strategic initiatives and is integral to the finance and accounting team, reporting directly to the President. The organization exclusively serves the construction and service-based trades.

IDEAL CANDIDATE

- Enthusiastic about data visualization and modeling.
- Constantly seeks out the latest products and approaches tasks with curiosity.
- Desires recognition as a significant contributor rather than getting lost in corporate dynamics.
- Passionate about Concierge Financials & Accounting, caring deeply about clients and customizing solutions for optimal visual and data representation.
- Prefers meaningful work over large volume production accounting firms.
- Takes pride in being a valuable team resource.
- Eager to transition from corporate BPO to a more fulfilling role.
- Values teamwork, quick thinking, and being part of organizational growth.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Budgeting and Forecasting:

- Gain a thorough understanding of the organization's funding models, seeking opportunities for improvement and modernization.
- Assist in the monthly and annual budgeting process, collaborating with operations and controllers to develop initial budgets.
- Lead the utilization and enhancement of budgeting and modeling tools, exploring new solutions.
- Analyze monthly financial reports and offer recommendations based on trends and insights.
- Work closely with operations and controllers to refine monthly forecasts and develop tools for sharing financial information with stakeholders.

Support to President and Operations:

- Provide support to the President and operations with minimal direction, demonstrating self-initiated follow-through to complete tasks accurately and timely, even amidst interruptions or distractions.

Reporting and Analysis:

- Collaborate with the Director of Finance to enhance multi-year projection models, covering income statements, balance sheets, and cash flows.
- Conduct standard and ad hoc analyses, delivering reports on financial and operational aspects to management.
- Partner with operations and controllers to achieve financial sustainability, identifying key variances and developing strategies for improvement.
- Lead and participate in annual continuous improvement projects.

RESPONSIBILITIES

- Perform financial analysis using various methods such as trend, variance, and ratio analysis.
- Develop financial models to forecast future performance and identify potential risks or opportunities.
- Prepare and present reports on findings and recommendations to senior management.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and provide financial insights for decision-making.
- Monitor industry trends and market conditions to inform recommendations regarding investments or business strategies.
- Assist in the preparation of budgets and financial plans.
- Conduct cost-benefit analysis for potential projects or investments.
- Ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and company policies.
- Analyze financial data to identify trends, variances, and improvement opportunities.
- Perform variance analysis and provide recommendations for corrective actions.
- Deeply understand the reporting capabilities of the various platforms that house the information we need.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or a related field; CPA or CMA certification is advantageous.
QBO Certification
3 years of professional experience in accounting or finance.
Proficiency in QuickBooks preferred.
Financial modeling and data analysis – excellent proficiency
Strong analytical skills with meticulous attention to detail.
Excellent communication, verbal and written. Create the presentation story (You will not be required to present to clients)
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Highly organized with the capacity to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

title: Operations Coordinator - HVAC/Refrigeration
description:
***PLEASE DO NOT APPLY FOR THIS POSITION IF YOU DO NOT HAVE EXPERIENCE IN THE HEATING, VENTILATION, AIR CONDITIONING, AND REFRIGERATION INDUSTRY***

Our company is a leader in HVAC/R predictive maintenance and management for small commercial buildings. They offer a unique pairing of software and services to save customers money on emergency repairs and energy bills. The technology leverages smart sensors and artificial intelligence to detect HVAC and Refrigeration issues early, and they work with a preferred network of qualified contractors to fix these issues before they lead to system failure.

About the Position:
We are seeking to hire an Operations Coordinator.

The Coordinator partners with the network of contractors and internal teams to deliver exceptional customer service experiences. The coordinator is responsible for taking inbound calls from customers and assisting them to the best of their ability. The role requires prior customer service experience, with a proven ability to multi-task and speak to and assist a wide range of customers.

This role presents an amazing opportunity to step up to an impactful, high-growth role and take on the following responsibilities:

-Manage daily scheduling and support of contractors, emergency repair requests, maintenance visits, and other HVAC/R projects
-Answer customer and contractor inquiries by phone, text, email, and web in a timely manner
-Enter and manage work orders, jobs, and clients on a dispatch board using established processes
-Issue purchase orders for service
-Process payments
-Manage customer concerns and work to resolve them efficiently and effectively

Requirements:
-Excellent English communication skills: verbal, written, and reading - MUST
-HVAC industry experience - MUST
-Experience in customer service with a strong commitment to customer happiness and satisfaction
-Experience problem-solving to meet customer needs
-Strong computer skills
-Ability to learn new technology, share knowledge, and provide feedback to improve our company's internal processes
-Ability to work independently and in a team setting
-Ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment and excellent time management skills
-A positive, can-do attitude and eagerness for continuous improvement
-Experience with Zoho tools (Zoho desk, Zoho books, CRM) - ADVANTAGE

Work Schedule:
-This is a full-time position in a work-from-home setup. You will be working 8 hours a day, 5 days a week.


TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION, FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW:
1. Include the phrase "HVAC" in your SUBJECT.
2. Send a COVER LETTER with a LINK to your CV/Resume.

***APPLICATIONS WITHOUT CVS/RESUMES WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED***

title: Developer
description:
LOCATION: Remote
COMPANY: www.madx.digital 

ABOUT US
At MADX, we are dedicated to helping SaaS & Technology businesses. We are seeking a passionate and experienced Developer to tackle complex technical challenges, work on clients websites, build internal tools & automation, and build/manage micro SaaS projects using front-end and back-end technologies.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The Developer will be responsible for addressing the more technical aspects of SEO, client website development, creating & supporting internal automations and tools, and handling various micro projects. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, creativity, and problem-solving skills to ensure our clients' websites perform at their best & tools to support our internal teams.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
- Collaborate with the SEO team to identify and resolve technical SEO issues
- Support and/or Implement technical SEO recommendations for clients
- Build & support new development requirements for clients websites (i.e. new pages, components, new functionality)
- Create and maintain internal tools and automations to streamline processes and enhance efficiency
- Conduct technical audits to ensure website health and performance
- Stay updated with the latest web development trends, SEO best practices, and search engine algorithms
- Provide technical support and troubleshooting for website-related issues
- Assist in managing and executing various micro projects as a full stack engineer

QUALIFICATIONS
- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar
- 5+ years experience in development roles
- Proven experience as a Web Developer with a strong focus on SEO
- Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and other web development languages
- Familiarity with the CMS platforms: WordPress, Webflow & Hubspot
- Experience with technical SEO tools such as Google Search Console, Screaming Frog, and other auditing tools
- Understanding of SEO best practices, including site architecture, page speed optimization, and schema markup
- Ability to translate design mockups into functional web pages
- Experience with automation tools like Zapier
- Experience with Back-end technologies and frameworks such as Node.js, APIs, Python
- Experience with Infrastructure like AWS, Google Cloud, etc
- Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
- Excellent communication and collaboration abilities


WHAT WE OFFER
- Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses
- Unlimited Paid Time Off (Holidays)
- Flexible working hours and remote work options
- Opportunities for professional development and growth
- A collaborative and supportive team environment
- Access to the latest SEO tools and resources


HOW TO APPLY
Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume, a cover letter detailing their development experience, and examples of past development successes to chat. Please include "MADX Developer - [Your Name] - [Your Years Experience]" in the subject line.

APPLICATION DEADLINE: 26th August 2024

title: Podcast Video Editors
description:
ABOUT Podcast360
We are a podcasting post-production and editing service. Our clients rely on us to edit their audio and video content efficiently for posting on YouTube and traditional audio podcast platforms. We also provide full-time staffing for their teams.

PLEASE READ THIS PAGE THOROUGHLY AND YOU CAN FIND THE EDITING APPLICATION FORM AT THE BOTTOM

We’re looking for and hiring multiple:
1. Podcast Editors with strong Descript and Premiere Pro experience who are excited to edit podcasts and videos that get thousands of views
2. Video Editors who are skilled in editing and basic animations for long-form video and podcast editing

Why we do it:
- Video is the fastest-growing and most scalable medium for organic customer acquisition
- Businesses owning organic distribution channels (vs constantly buying media) will dominate the future of marketing.
- We want to help as many people as possible to automate and simplify their work and their lives.

Example Long Form Videos
1. Creator Science Podcast by Jay Clouse
2. Lenny's Podcast
3. They're Just Movies Podcast
4. My First Million Podcast
5. All-In Podcast

You’re a good fit if...
1. You are experienced with video/audio editing with the latest version of Descript
2. You have previous experience working with a podcast post-production company
3. You understand both Premiere Pro, and After Effects and have a strong motion graphics, color grading, and design background (not just simple editing)
4. You are experienced in using AI tools like Claude & ChatGPT to work on show notes (YouTube Descriptions)
5. You appreciate nuanced sound design and selecting the best music gives you a silly amount of satisfaction
6. You are adept at creating custom after-effects animations that bring ideas to life on screen
7. You don’t need to be given the same feedback multiple times, you pay attention to revision rounds so that everybody’s time is respected (including yours)
8. You’re an excellent communicator who proactively clarifies instructions and deadlines so your team can succeed.
9. You’re results-oriented and care about integrating feedback to improve your craft with each video
10. You are interested in using AI and Automation to improve the video creation and editing process - We use AI tools daily

Compensation
- We’re searching for experienced podcast video editors with YouTube & short-form video editing backgrounds. - - Compensation begins on a part-time basis but after a 2-week trial period, we offer competitive full-time rates 
- Full-time team members also receive paid vacation and performance-based bonuses after their first 90 days
- We have tons of work for both long and short-form videos and are always hiring multiple editors.

Hiring Process
- Our goal is to have every candidate complete our hiring process in 10 days or less.
- Once you submit your application to the form below, we will review your portfolio and reach out to you via email within 48 hours.
- We’ll assign a trial assignment (Not paid) that is similar to the portfolio above and simulates our day-to-day work to evaluate your editing, animation, and communication skills. We will evaluate it and reach back out within 48 hours.
- If you meet the editing style we are looking for, hire & onboard you within 5 business days.

Application Form APPLY HERE: https://forms.clickup.com/4557696/f/4b2w0-1068/GNEJ8A1BE8B3PFTTAC

title: : CLINICAL LAB IT SPECIALIST
description:
Position Overview:
We are seeking for a highly skilled Clinical Lab IT Specialist. The ideal candidate should have a strong background in both IT and clinical laboratory science, ensuring seamless operation and integration of the Laboratory Information System (LIS) and associated technologies.

JOB TYPE - full time, 100% Work-from-Home ( Contract - 6 months)
Required hours: 40 hours per week | Eastern Standard Time 

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

• LIS Administration and Management:
o Administer and maintain the Laboratory Information System (LIS).
o Understand and manage clinical lab terminologies, test menus, and lab report formats.
o Oversee LIS internal data workflows, including data generation, translation, setup, and administration.
o Manage LIS interfaces with lab equipment and other data sources.
o Facilitate LIS data exchange with external sources and destinations, with a strong grasp of HL7 standards.
o Utilize commercial tools (e.g., Mirth) and scripting languages (JavaScript, Python) to manage data workflows.

• Network System Administration:
o Set up and administer internet/intranet systems.
o Implement and manage security systems.
• Office Software and Automation:
o Set up and administer PC systems.
o Manage Google Suite and Microsoft Office applications.
o Oversee office print/scan/fax/email applications.

Education Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering, Computer Science, Clinical Lab Science, or a related field.

Key Skills:
• Proficiency in PC/Data/Clinical Lab management
• Strong understanding of LIS applications and administration
• Expertise in network system setup and administration
• Competency with office software and automation

Qualifications:
• In-depth knowledge of laboratory information systems and clinical laboratory workflows.
• Proficiency in network and security system administration.
• Advanced skills in office software and automation, including macros.
• Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
• Strong communication and teamwork skills.

RESOURCES NEEDED :
- Minimum PC specification (at least core i4)
- Should have stable internet
- with Webcam
- Headset and microphone


ABOUT OUR CLIENT:

DDL is a US based company engaged in full-service laboratory providing hematology, chemistry, toxicology, immunology, and virology testing. They provide personalized, efficient, quality-oriented laboratory services.

DDL is a growing force in the healthcare industry and have been providing customized service to a wide array of clientele, including Physicians’ Offices, Pain management Clinics, Urgent Cares, and more.

Why Join DDL?
• Be a part of a growing company in the healthcare industry.
• Professional development and growth opportunities.

If you meet the above qualifications and you are passionate about leveraging your IT skills to improve laboratory operations and deliver high-quality healthcare services, we encourage you to apply.

title: DISPATCHER
description:
We are looking to hire a Dispatcher as we transform the single-family rental landscape, and we need dispatchers like you to be the navigators of this journey! Your mission? Dive into a dynamic role where you'll handle client requests, communicate with tenants, and schedule technicians efficiently. If you thrive in fast-paced environments and have a knack for turning chaos into seamless operations, this role is your stage for making a real impact!

This opportunity is ideal for someone looking to thrive in a supportive environment that values personal growth, rewards hard work, and champions a healthy work-life balance.


Responsibilities of the Customer Service Representative/Dispatcher:

Your responsibilities include:

Customer Service:

Receive and process incoming service requests via phone, email, or online platforms
Listen actively, reassure customers, and de-escalate situations
Manage inbound phone calls and troubleshoot issues with tenants before dispatching technicians
Keep customers informed about service statuses, estimated arrival times, and any delays
Follow up with customers, especially after service, to ensure satisfaction and gather feedback
Project Management / Dispatch Coordination:

Prioritize and assign service tasks to field technicians based on expertise, availability, and location
Monitor ongoing jobs to ensure timely completion and customer satisfaction
Collaborate with technicians to provide the necessary information, materials, and tools for each assignment
Optimize technician schedules to maximize efficiency and minimize travel time
Coordinate routes for technicians to reduce travel distances and environmental impact
Manage appointments, cancellations, and rescheduling while handling urgent requests appropriately
Close out work orders with clear documentation and updates in the system and client portal
Other Administrative Tasks:

Maintain accurate records of service requests, work orders, and customer interactions
Coordinate with accounting for invoicing, payment tracking, and billing information processing
Manage inventory levels of maintenance supplies and equipment, coordinating replenishment with technicians
Assist in preparing reports, data analysis, and performance metrics as required



Perks:
13th Month Bonus (Wild right?!)
Permanent work-from-home / remote set-up 
Health insurance 
Dental insurance 
Mental health insurance 
Great starting salary 
Growth opportunity 
Performance-based raises 
Prizes and bonuses 

Specifics:

Time

Full-time, MST/EST time zone
This is a remote position so you can have the freedom to work from anywhere
EST - Weekends (Daytime)
MST - Weekdays (After-Hours)
Miscellaneous

Attire - business casual when in meetings
Professional setup (Pains me I actually need to write this down…)
Clean background
Good camera
Good microphone
Strong wifi
Tech Stack

Microsoft Suite
MS Teams
Project Management Tools (nice to have)
Dispatch Operating Portal (nice to have)
Compensation

$9.6k-13.2k/yr

For interested applicant: Please send your updated CV to nolascobree@gmail.com with a Subject line: " DISPATCHER"

title: Project Management Virtual Assistant
description:

When you join 2xYou, a Sister company of Valhalla Online Services, you’ll enjoy the following benefits:
- Laid-back, relaxed and fun environment
- HMO after 3 months

- Team building and company outings
- Fun projects that provide learning
- Access to books and courses to help you learn anything you want
- Generous leave policy

About the job:
Work with the most supportive team, and get coached and fully trained so you can be the best at who you need to be!

If you’re not familiar with any of these tasks yet, don’t worry! We’ll train you in what you need to know - just as long as you’re a good fit.

The primary tasks for this job position will be:

- Pulling KPI metrics (Sales, Marketing, etc) on regular intervals.
- Create standard operating procedures
- Understand varied Sales Cycles depending on Job Type.
- Help manage day-to-day operations
- Manage emails -
- Outlook/GHL: Manage calendar schedules
- Manage event research
- GHL: Manage CRM
- Qualifying leads prior to sending project over to be Estimated or setting up a Site Visit
- Construction Subcontractor onboarding
- Scope Template creation.
- Create / Manage Personal CRM for contacts and networking.
- Daily Meeting for To-Do & Deliverable Handoff
- Draft documents to be reviewed and be sent out, may vary in nature
- Marketing Tasks:
- Build and implement an SOP with Yard Signs, Mailers, Door Hangers, FB campaign budget to switch on at will depending on the project.
- Document an estimated cost of these campaigns.
- Build Personal Branding: As a complement to the business marketing for Construction Services and Real Estate
- Content/Social Media Tasks:
- Utilize Built-in social media planner to start putting out project stills or company activity.
- Build Social Media Presence
- Post flyer / landing page seasonally when certain services grow in demand
- Utilize Current projects for online content
- Tech Tasks
- Setting up automations and collaboration on new automation opportunities
- Create and Maintain 'input' channels from other parties to me and or from me to EA
- Project Management Tasks
- Manage different kinds of projects including the sprints and execution.
- Project Goal Highlight: Creating/Documenting 'Productized Service' offerings.
- Collaboration on Staging Upcoming Projects:
- Field Crew Preparation: Assignment of project or scope item to team member, translate/transcribe sold scope of work to Spanish, Material Procurement for Starting Job, Check on Delivery Orders
- Processing Subcontractor Bid Requests, PO's, Bills
- Misc Tasks
- Personal: Calendar time blocks for fitness, reminders to check in with some family periodically, etc.
- General Research

About the client:
At our General contracting business, trust-building is the cornerstone of everything we do. With a commitment to integrity and quality craftsmanship, we strive to build lasting relationships with our clients. From the initial consultation to the final nail, we prioritize proactive communication and collaboration, ensuring that your vision is brought to life with precision and care. Choose us as your Trusted partner in construction.

We are an assistant outsourcing agency where we specialize in hiring, managing, and growing executive assistants for solopreneurs and small business owners.


Are you eager to keep learning new skills?
Do you value self-growth and development?
Do you enjoy a flexible work schedule and a fun culture?
Are you self-responsible and someone who honors your commitments?

If the answer is YES, then we need someone like you!

We are looking for Project Management Virtual Assistant.

Basic Requirements:
- You live in Cebu
- You have good operational skills
- You love learning and you are always working hard on making yourself better
- You like helping others
- You work hard to do great work, but you are also willing to make mistakes
- You’re brave and willing to take action where the action is needed
- You’re a problem solver

Technical Requirements:
- High School diploma required / Bachelor’s degree preferred
- Administrative Executive Assistant experience with:
- Project Management
- Social Media Content Management
- Digital Marketing

Salary Range is: [Php30,000-33,000] per month (depending on experience).
We are looking forward to meeting you!

To apply, simply fill out this form: https://form.jotform.com/201028523533445

Company Overview:
2xYou Executive Assistant Services is not like your usual “assistant” company. We make sure that both the client and assistant are constantly growing in both business and skills.

We give full support to the assistant to empower the business owner and make sure that the relationship is growing as well.

Why join us:
If you want to continue to make progress in life by learning, getting new experiences, and being around highly knowledgeable, helpful people, this is the place for you.

We are a human-centric tribe of people highly committed to solving problems for other humans through business and innovation. However, it is our tribe that we focus on first and foremost as we can solve many more problems in amazing ways with happy, healthy people who are always learning and growing.

title: URGENT: MEDIA BUYER FOR MED SPA
description:
PLEASE FOLLOW "How to Apply" INSTRUCTIONS 

We are looking for a badass Media Buyer who who has a vast experience in Web Automation, Google, YouTube, and Facebook Ads. A hardworking individual who knows how to turn a document into a whole campaign, and loves solving problems, you might be the missing piece in our team!

Our ultimate vision as a company is to help Cryotherapy companies achieve greater heights and generate more revenue by providing them with qualified leads and appointments every single month.

Your work will help us achieve these goals with our clients. As we help them grow, we help their future customers get products/services they need, and at the same time we create jobs for people as our clients’ businesses grow.
count with the most efficient and effective workflows and funnels and make sure that everything is working accordingly.

Responsibilities:

Figure out how to solve issues such as high Cost Per Lead, CPM, etc.
Create and manage cross channel promotions (Retargeting).
Create weekly strategies that consider previous results, iterates on what works, and moves away from what doesn’t.
Manage client ad accounts and perform daily optimizations.
Identify and create a decision making framework to go along with rules to optimize the accounts on a consistent basis.
Create documentation for clients to streamline team processes and workflows.
Direct and communicate with the creative team and copywriters to produce ads that convert.
Stay on top of the latest trends in Facebook Ads and Digital Marketing.
Grow to manage millions in ad spend per month, helping our clients generate millions more in revenue for their business.
Create and manage Zapier automations.
Should know how to build out triggers and turn a document into a campaign in Go High-level Software.


Qualifications:

At least 2 years of Media Buyer preferably for Health & Wellness industry experience
At least 2 years of experience in automation
Knowledge and experience in automations using Zapier
Experience in building codes to connect APIs is a PLUS
Work-from-home setup with at least 20 mbps main internet service provider; Dual Monitor PC; 4GB RAM; at least an i5 processor
Backup internet connection with at least 10mbps and backup power that can last up to 8 hours

Other Details:
Company Name: Growth Now Media
Salary Offer: $1500 - $3000 (DOE)
Work Shift: Mon-Fri (10PM to 7AM PH Time)

HOW TO APPLY: If you are who we’re looking for, send your application (CV & Vocaroo recording of your self-intro) through this email: ivy.c@growthnowmedia.com with a subject line: Your Media Buyer

We are looking to hire immediately!

description:

Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive individual to join our team as an Entry-Level Solar
Interconnections Engineer. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in facilitating the interconnection process for commercial solar energy projects, ensuring efficient and timely connection to the electrical grid. Collaborating closely with internal teams, external stakeholders, and regulatory authorities, you will navigate the solar interconnection procedures and requirements. This position offers an excellent opportunity for someone passionate about solar energy and eager to launch their career in this rapidly growing field.

Job Description:

The Interconnections Engineer plays a pivotal role in overseeing interconnection applications and providing essential support to the Sales, Engineering, and Construction departments for commercial and multifamily projects within California. This key team member is tasked with ensuring the efficient and precise approval of interconnection applications while offering expert guidance on all interconnection requirements. The ideal candidate is a hybrid of a computer engineer and a financial analyst, adept at writing code and understanding financial statements, bridging the gap between technical engineering and financial analysis.


Core Responsibilities:

Manage interconnection applications for commercial and multifamily solar projects in California, ensuring compliance with regulations.
Prepare and submit accurate interconnection applications to utility companies and coordinate for timely approvals.
Stay updated on changes in interconnection regulations and requirements.
Resolve interconnection-related issues by coordinating with utility companies and stakeholders.
Provide guidance and support to internal departments for interconnection tasks.
Conduct technical analysis of interconnection issues and offer solutions.
Communicate with project stakeholders on interconnection matters and maintain documentation.
Execute Interconnection Agreements and monitor progress.
Support solar energy projects’ interconnection process, including research and compliance adherence.
Collaborate with internal teams to gather information for solar interconnection applications.

Monitor and track the progress of solar interconnection applications, addressing issues proactively.
Maintain accurate documentation and records related to solar interconnection activities.
Coordinate with external stakeholders to ensure smooth solar interconnection processes.
Provide administrative support to the solar interconnections team.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Engineering or Finance.
Strong interest in solar energy and sustainable development.
Excellent organizational skills with a keen eye for detail and accuracy.
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, for interaction with internal and external stakeholders.
Collaborative mindset with the ability to build positive relationships in a team environment.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and project management software.
Familiarity with solar interconnection processes, regulations, and policies is advantageous.
Adaptability to changing priorities and the capacity to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Demonstrated problem-solving skills and the ability to work autonomously.
Commitment to maintaining confidentiality and handling sensitive information professionally.

TO APPLY, FILL OUT THIS FORM: https://forms.clickup.com/9011062867/f/8chku2k-8851/K321R6U06SA6W61YCS

title: GHL Automations, AI Specialist - SEO knowledge a plus
description:
***Minimum 2 years GHL experience required***

Headquartered in sunny Southwest Florida, Webspark Media is a digital advertising
company that specializes in local business marketing. It’s our mission to deliver high-
quality services while building meaningful relationships with our clients, partners, each
other, and those in the community around us.
We not only guarantee the best results for our clients. Our goal is to become a long-term
growth partner that helps them build their dream business.
This mission also applies to our team. We are nearly 100% remote, and we encourage
our employees to work from anywhere in the world!
Webspark is at the forefront of digital marketing and customer relationship management, leveraging advanced software solutions and AI to drive growth and enhance client engagement. As a partner of GoHighLevel, we utilize its comprehensive suite of tools to deliver exceptional results in marketing automation, sales funnels, and customer service. Our team is dedicated to innovative solutions and exceptional client outcomes. We cultivate talented
individuals into leaders. We believe leaders and hard workers come from the desire to
grow. With a great leader comes a great team, and with a great team comes a greater
and stronger company.

Our #1 Core Value: Be Responsible
Take Responsibility. For yourself, for your clients, for the wins, and especially for the
failures. We own mistakes and use them as an opportunity to get better. The only two
words you will never hear at this company are “fault” and “blame.”
If this mindset does not resonate with you, please do not bother applying.

Job Description
The High Level (GHL) Implementation Specialist will be responsible for owning the
technical aspects of GHL, whether that’s troubleshooting, digging into
our app, or whatever behind-the-scenes magic needs to happen to ensure our
customers are set up for success. Our ideal candidate has a deep understanding of GoHighLevel.com software and a proven track record in digital marketing and automation. This role demands a blend of technical expertise and strategic thinking, with the responsibility of integrating and optimizing HighLevel functionalities to meet our unique business needs and exceed client expectations. GHL specialist will be responsible for automation within Click-up and slack as well as utilizing AI to improve results and efficiency.

• Responsible for working with the Client Success team to onboard and integrate new clients
• Set up customers for immediate success by facilitating the implementation process for
new accounts
• Own and manage the GHL onboarding process from customer commitment stage
through to product activation
• Plant the product integration strategy in order to minimize integration times
• Test and troubleshoot the client’s implementation, providing feedback
• Contribute to the improvements of different application integration methodologies
• Integrate plugins with Go High Level
• Set up pipelines and calendar booking in Go High Level

(GHL)
• A plus if you can create stunning sales funnels in Go High Level for Webspark Media and its clients
• Utilize systems for the management, tracking, and execution of onboarding projects
• Responsible for the accurate input of system information and account set up for new
clients
• Excellent written communicator
• Organized
• Positive attitude
• Patient
• Experience working in an application ecosystem and integrating 3rd party technologies
• Proven experience in working with APIs and fundamental understanding of how they
work
• Good project management mindset
• Working knowledge of the following technologies and software: Go High Level (GHL),
Make, CHatGPT and Click up
• Team player but can work independently, too
• Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks
• Highly resourceful, self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership in areas of
responsibility
• Very organized, exceptional attention-to-detail

Benefits
? Remote position (work from anywhere in the world)
? Competitive pay
? Potential for performance bonuses
? Training library
? Access to world-class training and education
? Laid back, yet professional vibe

In your application, provide a resume and cover letter. Send an email to humanresources@websparkmedia.net. Subject line: GHL Rockstar. Failure to follow these directions will result in immediate disqualification from applying.

title: Computer Database, GIS, and Research
description:

Location: Remote

Position: Full-Time

Key Responsibilities:

Develop moderate to advanced specialized maps using geographic and demographic information.
Produce detailed demographic reports from local, regional, and national datasets.
Collect, verify, and edit GIS data sets to provide mapping services and technical research and analysis related to geographical data sets using software applications.
Design, develop, and maintain data sets using ESRI Geographic Information Systems Software (ArcGIS), related ArcGIS desktop applications, and SQL Server and Oracle database platforms for data visualization.

Provide GIS technical reports to stakeholders and respond to inquiries related to GIS datasets and issues.

Create and manage map templates for editing and printing purposes.

Provide back-up coverage to regional and national teams as required.

title: Service Desk Technician
description:
Please apply for this job here:
https://sourcepass.careers/job-openings/?gh_jid=4416292005

We are Sourcepass, an IT consulting company (MSP) with a rich history of providing network support and innovative solutions since 2001. Our expertise spans IT services, cloud computing, and security, that tailor the right technologies to specific industries and business strategies. Sourcepass aims to be different. It is owned and operated by technology, security, and managed services experts who are passionate about delivering an IT experience that clients love.
Sourcepass has acquired and continues to acquire companies across all avenues of technology bringing more than 40 years of expertise to all of our service areas. 

Today, Sourcepass comprises over six hundred employees serving more than two thousand clients across twenty unique vertical markets. And the best is yet to be.

Our achievements speak for themselves: named to the Inc. 2022 Best in Business list, honored with two 2023 Stevie® Awards, listed on CRN’s 2023 Solution Provider 500, and recognized in Gartner’s 2024 Magic Quadrant™. Most recently, we were awarded PAX8's 2024 Partner of the Year and designated as Microsoft CoPilot MVP. We take pride in these accolades and continue to push boundaries in the IT consulting industry. Join us and be part of our journey toward even greater accomplishments.

POSITION SUMMARY

As a Service Desk Technician, you will be responsible for working closely with our clients, providing advanced Level II IT knowledge, tools, and problem-solving skills to determine, diagnose and solve all IT-related issues. This is a fully remote position with various shifts in the Eastern Time Zone.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Set up workstations with computers and necessary peripheral devices (routers, printers etc.)   
Check computer hardware (HDD, mice, keyboards etc.) to ensure functionality 
Install and configure appropriate software and functions according to specifications  
Diagnose and maintain local networks in ways that optimize performance
Ensure security and privacy of networks and computer systems
Provide orientation and guidance to users on how to operate software and computer equipment 
Organize and schedule diagnostic testing around client availability to inhibit impact 
Perform troubleshooting to diagnose and resolve problems (repair or replace parts, etc.)   
Maintain records of support interactions and time spent in ConnectWise (communication, diagnostics tests / results)   
Identify and document computer or network equipment warranty issues and communicate them internally.   
Act as a liaison between Vendors and clients for open vendor support requests

DESIRED SKILLSET/EXPERIENCE

Technical Support Experience: 3-5 Years (Preferred)   
Experience working with Azure (A plus)   
Experience working with Office 365 (Preferred)   
Experience working with SonicWall devices (Preferred)   
Experience working with HP Devices (Preferred) 
Ability to communicate effectively
Ability to Prioritize multiple tasks effectively 
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to work independently and in a team environment 
Proven Experience as a Technical Support Analyst or relevant position  
CompTIA A+ and Network+ will be required within 1 year of hire.

Microsoft, Apple, SonicWall, Cisco, and other IT vendor certifications desirable.

title: software development team
description:
Job Title: Software Development Engineer and Team

Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Description:
We are seeking experienced and passionate software engineers to help build a development team as we have a vision to build an innovative and scalable capital investment and real estate platform. The platform will connect investors and users, offering real-time interactions, financial transactions, and a seamless user experience similar to platforms like Robinhood, Facebook, Twitter, Edward Jones and Fidelity.

You will collaborate with a diverse, cross-functional team to design, develop, and deploy high-quality software. Our goal is to build a feature-rich platform that is secure, user-friendly, and scalable to accommodate millions of users.

Responsibilities:
Full-Stack Development: Design, develop, and maintain both backend and frontend components of the platform.
Feature Development: Build and implement new features, such as real-time messaging, user profiles, notifications, transaction systems, and social networking tools.
Scalability: Ensure the platform's ability to scale across millions of users, focusing on performance, availability, and reliability.
Security: Implement best practices in security, especially regarding financial transactions, user data, and privacy concerns.
Collaborative Problem-Solving: Work closely with product managers, UX/UI designers, data engineers, and other developers to define project requirements and develop solutions.
Testing & Deployment: Participate in the testing process, debugging issues, and ensuring smooth deployment using CI/CD pipelines.
System Architecture: Assist in defining and developing the platform’s system architecture, including APIs, databases, and cloud infrastructure.
Technology Research: Stay up to date on the latest trends and technologies to keep the platform cutting-edge.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Experience: 3+ years of experience in full-stack development, ideally for large-scale applications or social media platforms.
Tech Stack:
Frontend: React, Angular, Vue.js, or similar.
Backend: Node.js, Python (Django, Flask), Ruby on Rails, or similar.
Databases: Experience with relational (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and non-relational (MongoDB, Redis) databases.
APIs: Experience designing and developing RESTful APIs or GraphQL.
DevOps: Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, Azure; experience with Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines.
Version Control: Git, GitHub/GitLab.
Security: Understanding of modern security best practices in software development, especially for financial transactions and user data.
Communication: Excellent teamwork and communication skills, ability to collaborate with product and design teams effectively.
Preferred Skills:
Experience building real-time applications (WebSockets, live feeds, etc.).
Familiarity with microservices architecture.
Prior experience with highly scalable systems and load balancing.
Knowledge of machine learning or AI tools is a plus.
Experience with mobile app development is a plus (iOS/Android).

Salary Negotiable 
Interested candidates should submit their resume, portfolio, and a brief description of relevant projects they’ve worked on.

title: Web Design & Management Specialist
description:
About Us
Provinziano & Associates is a leading family law practice committed to providing exceptional legal services to our clients. We are seeking a talented Web Design & Management Specialist to join our marketing team and elevate our online presence.

Position Overview
The Web Design & Management Specialist will be responsible for managing, updating, and optimizing our WordPress website. This role is crucial in ensuring our website effectively represents our brand, provides an excellent user experience, and supports our digital marketing efforts.

Key Responsibilities

2. Design and implement new web pages and features that align with our brand and marketing objectives
3. Collaborate with the SEO & Content Specialist to implement on-page SEO best practices
4. Ensure website responsiveness and compatibility across various devices and browsers
5. Optimize website performance, including page load times and overall user experience
6. Implement and manage website analytics to track performance and user behavior
7. Conduct regular website audits and make recommendations for improvements
8. Manage website hosting, domain, and SSL certificate renewals
9. Create and update website content, including text, images, and videos
10. Ensure the website complies with legal requirements (e.g., accessibility standards, privacy policies)

12. Stay up-to-date with web design trends and emerging technologies

Required Qualifications

• Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript
• Strong knowledge of WordPress, including theme customization and plugin management
• Experience with responsive web design and mobile optimization
• Familiarity with SEO principles and best practices
• Understanding of web hosting and domain management

• Experience with web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics)

• Familiarity with graphic design tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite)

Personal Qualities
• Detail-oriented with a strong eye for design

• Team player who can collaborate effectively with other departments

Provinziano & Associates is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: MSP Systems Engineer - Automation, Patching, Monitoring, Backup & Optimization Specialist
description:

About Us:
We are a leading Managed Service Provider dedicated to delivering innovative IT & Cybersecurity solutions and exceptional service to our clients. We’re seeking a highly skilled Centralized Services Engineer to join our team. If you excel at optimizing automation systems, ensuring patch compliance, managing backup systems, and building solutions that reduce support workload while providing clear and relatable communication to clients, this role is for you.

Job Summary:
As a Centralized Services Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring the seamless operation of our automation systems, primarily using Datto RMM. Your role will involve optimizing these systems to minimize disruptions, maintaining patch compliance, managing and resolving backup system issues, and creating custom PowerShell scripts to enhance efficiency. You will also play a critical role in onboarding clients into our technology ecosystem and ensuring consistent application of our software and configuration stacks across client environments. While most of your time will focus on these tasks, you will also act as an escalation point for the support desk and project teams, providing backup support and participating in client projects as needed.

Key Responsibilities: 
• Monitor and maintain the RMM system
• Monitor and maintain the patching of our entire customer base (Windows, MacOS & applications)
• Backup system management
• Ensure our software and configuration stacks are installed and kept updated through our customer base
• Build and maintain PowerShell scripts to support automation tasks, reduce tickets, and streamline support processes
• Escalation Point For Tech Team

Qualifications: 
• MINIMUM 2 years experience working for an MSP
• MINIMUM 8 years of experience in the IT field
• Hands-on experience with Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) tools used in MSP companies like Datto RMM, Connectwise Automate, Syncro MSP, or Ninja RMM
• Experience with Microsoft Patching automation systems used in MSP RMM tools
• Skilled in creating PowerShell scripts for automation, implementation, and remediation
• Knowledge of Azure AD, Entra ID, Active Directory and highly experienced in building, configuring, maintaining, and migrating to/from these environments
• Experience managing backup systems for on-premises servers
• Experience in documenting projects, configurations, and client environments in systems like IT Glue
• A reliable internet connection and a dedicated quiet place to work from home that is free from distractions
• You must be able to work in the PST time zone
• Must have fluency in English, both written and oral (Must have a rating of C1 or C2 in English)

Why Join Us? 
• Growth Opportunities: We support continuous learning and professional development
• Collaborative Environment: Work with a team of experts who value your contributions
• Impactful Work: Play a critical role in projects that directly benefit our clients
• Competitive Compensation: We offer a salary and benefits package that reflects your skills and experience

To Apply:
If you’re ready to take your career to the next level and make a real impact, we want to hear from you. Apply today with your resume and a cover letter.

In your cover letter, please describe your MSP experience and how it relates to this role. Also, please use the following website Vocaroo | Online voice recorder (https://vocaroo.com) to record at least a 30-second introduction and provide a link to the recording with your cover letter. title: Senior Lead Developer
description:
Who We Are:
At Juris Digital we help law firms achieve sustainable growth through organic and paid search marketing is not just what Juris Digital delivers — it’s what drives our SEOs daily. Our team is smart and intelligent and knows what it takes to drive real revenue growth, and cares about the bottom-line outcomes. We’re competitive and collaborative, like to have fun, and love adding new team members to the group. If you are seeking a dynamic workplace and new challenges, we want to hear from you!

Work Location:
Anywhere but able to work on Mountain Time hours

Who we’re looking for:
As the Lead Developer at Juris Digital, you will play a pivotal role in guiding our development team while shaping the technical vision of our projects. With your creativity and innovative thinking, you’ll collaborate closely with designers, project managers, and other stakeholders to craft dynamic, responsive, and user-centric websites and digital solutions that exceed our clients’ expectations. Your responsibilities will encompass leading the entire development lifecycle—from strategic planning and coding to seamless deployment, SEO practices and ongoing maintenance—ensuring that every deliverable is on time, within budget, and meets the highest standards of excellence.

What you will do:
Technical Leadership: Lead and mentor the development team in creating and maintaining high-performance websites and digital applications, with a primary focus on law firms. Inspire innovative thinking and creative problem-solving within the team.
SEO Knowledge: Apply a strong understanding of SEO principles to ensure that all developed websites are optimized for search engines, enhancing visibility and driving organic traffic.
Project Management: Manage the technical aspects of multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring all deadlines are met, budgets are adhered to, and quality standards are consistently upheld.
Code Review: Conduct regular code reviews to maintain high code quality, enforce security standards, and ensure adherence to best practices across all projects.
Collaboration: Work closely with account managers, copywriters, and designers to understand client goals and translate them into effective and innovative visual and technical solutions.
Technology Stack: Define, implement, and optimize the technology stack for various projects, prioritizing scalability, performance, security, and adaptability to emerging technologies.
Client Interaction: Participate in client meetings to understand their technical requirements, provide expert advice, and translate their needs into actionable development plans that reflect creative and innovative solutions.
Problem-Solving: Proactively troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues that may arise during development and post-launch, ensuring minimal disruption to project timelines.
Innovative Thought: Drive innovation by actively seeking out and implementing cutting-edge technologies, methodologies, and creative solutions that push the boundaries of what’s possible in web development. Encourage the team to think outside the box and bring fresh ideas to every project.
Continuous Improvement: Stay on top of the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in web development. Apply this knowledge to improve our processes, products continuously, and the overall quality of work delivered to clients.

How you’ll do it:
Embody Juris Digital’s core values: Excellence, Fun, Creativity, Empathy, Transparency and Relationships
Curiosity – Ask really good questions of clients that drive creative solutions. You are compelled by the desire to learn more, ask more, and find new solutions for your partners that haven’t been previously thought of.
Work Ethic – Come to work to achieve. Use your time wisely to create opportunities, and understand that success results from hard work and diligence.
Intelligence – You can quickly learn and retain new information, processes, and abilities.
Coachability – Seek out and implement coaching on personal performance in order to improve. React calmly to criticism and are open to new ideas and changes in the process.
Self-motivation / Drive – You are driven to exceed minimum standards by your personal “why.”
Resilience and Perseverance – This isn’t your first rodeo. You weather your roles’ inevitable ups and downs with grace, professionalism, grit, and determination.

Our Ideal Candidate Will Be or Have: 
Experience: 5+ years of experience in web development, with at least 2 years in a leadership or senior development role.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in front-end and back-end technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (React, Angular, or Vue.js), PHP, MySQL, and familiarity with CMS platforms such as WordPress and Webflow. Experience with RESTful APIs, version control (Git), and deployment pipelines is essential.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Leadership: Proven experience leading a development team, with strong project management and team collaboration skills.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a focus on delivering high-quality solutions.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: A meticulous approach to code quality, security, and performance optimization. Please put a * next to your name when applying to ensure you read this whole post.
Legal Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with the legal industry or experience working on projects for law firms is a plus but not required.

Compensation:
Various factors determine the final compensation for this role, such as a candidate’s relevant work experience, skills, certifications, and geographic location.

Our Ideal Candidate Will Be or Have:
Excellent Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits for you and your family (2 of these plans Juris Digital covers 100% for the Employee)
Flexible Paid Time Off Program
9 Holidays Paid
401k Plan with employer match
Mental Health Days – Half-day Fridays
Monthly Internet stipend
New Hire Home Office set-up bonus
Annual Education / Development for your career growth

title: Email Marketing Specialist Job Description
description:
About Us
Provinziano & Associates is a respected family law practice dedicated to providing exceptional legal services to our clients. We are looking for a skilled and creative Email Marketing Specialist to join our marketing team on a part-time basis and help grow our email marketing initiatives.

Position Overview
The Email Marketing Specialist will be responsible for developing, implementing, and optimizing our email marketing campaigns. This role is crucial in nurturing leads, engaging with current and potential clients, and driving conversions through effective email communication strategies. The specialist will focus on creating segmented emails for different audiences and stages in the client journey.

Key Responsibilities
1. Develop and execute email marketing strategies aligned with our overall marketing goals
2. Create engaging, personalized email content for various campaigns and audience segments
3. Design and implement segmented email campaigns for different stages of the client journey
4. Design and build responsive email templates that reflect our brand identity
5. Manage and segment our email lists to ensure targeted and relevant communication
6. Implement A/B testing to optimize email performance (subject lines, content, send times, etc.)
7. Monitor and analyze email campaign metrics, providing regular performance reports
8. Continuously improve email marketing performance through data-driven insights
9. Ensure compliance with email marketing regulations and best practices
10. Collaborate with other marketing team members to align email efforts with overall marketing strategies
11. Stay up-to-date with email marketing trends and implement innovative tactics to improve results

Required Qualifications
• 2+ years of experience in email marketing
• Strong proficiency in English language, including excellent writing and editing skills
• Proficiency in email marketing platforms (e.g., Constant Contact, Mailchimp, or similar)
• Experience with email design and HTML coding for emails
• Understanding of email marketing metrics and ability to derive insights from data
• Familiarity with CRM systems and their integration with email marketing
• Knowledge of email marketing best practices and regulations (e.g., CAN-SPAM)
• Experience in creating segmented email campaigns for different audience groups and stages in the customer journey

Preferred Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field
• Experience in the legal industry, particularly family law
• Familiarity with marketing automation tools
• Knowledge of basic graphic design principles and experience with design tools
• Understanding of customer journey mapping and lead nurturing strategies

Personal Qualities
• Creative thinker with strong attention to detail
• Self-motivated and able to work independently
• Excellent time management skills
• Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities
• Team player with good communication skills
• Adaptable and open to feedback

Additional Information
• This is a part-time position with an expected monthly total of 40 hours
• Work hours may vary based on project needs (e.g., one week might require 20-30 hours, while the rest of the month might only require 10 hours total)
• Flexible working hours with the possibility of remote work

How to Apply
Please submit your resume, a brief cover letter, and 2-3 examples of successful email campaigns you've created. Please include ";Email Marketing Specialist Application - [Your Name]" in the subject line.

Provinziano & Associates is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Customer Support Associate
description:
Looking for an experienced customer support associate who can complete routine administrative tasks & respond to emails, in support of our existing customers. This is a part-time position, with less than 5-10 hours per week, with the potential for an increase in hours and responsibilities based on work performance and future client projects.

I am looking for someone who can communicate well, has strong attention to detail, and has previous experience providing support type services to customers.

You must be carefully follow step by step standard operating procedures (SOPs) with a high rate of accuracy (99%+), be an effective writer and send weekly emails to clients, and be able to proactively handle minor customer requests, such as adding photos to a website or responding to Google reviews/

Process
- Every Monday you will communicate with clients via email to check in, provide them with a list of any leads generated from the previous week, and ask how we can best support them.
- You will review a routine task checklist, and complete any Social Media or SEO related task that is due for each client, by using the provided SOP’s.
- You will monitor the support email inbox and respond to all emails within 24 hours of receipt.

Bonus
- Experience using Google Suite, GoHighlevel, and any experience with website builders (elementor, Gohighlevel, clickfunnels).

About Us: A marketing agency, supporting general contractors (kitchen, bathroom, home addition remodels) by offering SEO services.

The ability to complete tasks on time, communicate early & often, and to be a problem solver are very important.

We are based in the USA, Eastern Standard Time. Any client correspondence (emails) should occur during normal USA working hours (8AM - 5PM EST), while any routine tasks can be completed at your own discretion. We will communicate primarily via slack, with the occasional Zoom Video Call.

Additionally, you should have good internet, back-up connectivity, a good power source, a generator in case power goes out, and a well-functioning computer.

If you are interested in this position, please include in the first sentence of your response “Customer Support for Contractors" and your favorite hobby. Also please include a link to your Resume/CV. Applicants will not be contacted who forget this.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Digital Marketing Project Manager for Chiropractic Practices
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Digital Marketing Project Manager to join our team and lead marketing initiatives for chiropractic practices. This role is crucial in driving digital marketing strategies and ensuring successful project delivery for our chiropractic clients. The ideal candidate will possess a unique blend of project management expertise, digital marketing knowledge, and excellent communication skills.
Key Responsibilities:
Oversee and manage multiple digital marketing projects for chiropractic clients, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to budgets
Develop comprehensive project plans, including scope, timelines, resources, and budgets tailored to chiropractic practices
Coordinate with internal teams and external stakeholders to execute digital marketing campaigns across various channels
Monitor project progress, identify potential risks, and implement solutions to keep projects on track
Analyze project performance using tools like Google Analytics and report on key metrics relevant to chiropractic practices
Manage client relationships with chiropractors, providing regular updates and addressing concerns promptly
Stay updated on digital marketing trends and technologies specific to the chiropractic industry, incorporating innovative strategies into projects
Required Skills and Qualifications:
Expert in HighLevel CRM:
Demonstrate advanced proficiency in HighLevel CRM for managing chiropractic client relationships and marketing automation
Ability to leverage HighLevel's features for project tracking, client communication, and campaign management in the chiropractic context
Expert in Project Management:
Proven experience in managing complex digital marketing projects for healthcare providers, particularly chiropractors
Strong knowledge of project management methodologies and best practices
Proficiency in project management software and tools
Client-Facing Skills:
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to effectively manage expectations and relationships with chiropractic clients
Ability to present project plans, progress reports, and results to chiropractors professionally
Strong problem-solving skills to address client concerns and project challenges specific to chiropractic practices
Fluent English:
Native-level English proficiency in both written and verbal communication
Ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and concisely to team members and chiropractic clients
Additional Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Digital Marketing, Business, or related field
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in digital marketing project management, preferably with healthcare or chiropractic clients
In-depth understanding of various digital marketing channels, including SEO, PPC, social media, and content marketing as they apply to chiropractic practices
Familiarity with web analytics tools and performance measurement techniques relevant to chiropractic marketing
Strong leadership and team management skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
Understanding of HIPAA compliance and other healthcare marketing regulations
What We Offer:
Competitive salary commensurate with experience
Opportunity to work with diverse chiropractic clients and projects
Professional growth and skill development opportunities
Flexible work hours and remote work options
If you are a results-driven Digital Marketing Project Manager with a passion for delivering exceptional outcomes for chiropractic clients, we want to hear from you. Join our team and play a pivotal role in shaping successful digital marketing strategies for chiropractic practices.
To apply, please submit your resume, portfolio of past projects (especially those related to healthcare or chiropractic marketing), and a brief cover letter explaining why you're the ideal candidate for this position. We look forward to learning about your expertise and how you can contribute to our team's success in the chiropractic marketing space.

title: Construction Purchasing Manager
description:
As purchasing manager you will be responsible for the entire purchasing process. This includes bid requests, contracting , insurance program enrollment, and generating purchase orders. You are the critical link between a project going from site development to vertical construction. In this role you must have a strong attention to detail, have a passion for being organized, deliberate follow through on completing tasks, enjoy analyzing and negotiating bids and ability to self motivate. This position will report into our Chief Financial Officer / Head of Purchasing. 

Requisites
- Fluent in English
- Strong English writing skills (email)
- 4-6 years of experience in Back office function (Purchasing / Finance / Accounting etc)
- Strong Google Sheets
- Reliable internet connection with ability to attend Daily video calls via Skype and Google meet
- Hours of operation 9 AM - 5 PM Pacific Standard Time Monday through Friday
- Experience with preparing contracts, using DocuSign
- Willingness to learn and take on new challenges

Job Responsibilities
Primary Tasks
- Tracking and maintaining records and responses
- Data input
- Generating and Responding to emails with consistent follow up
- Maintaining organized file system

Purchasing
- Maintain database of trades and vendors
- Review scope of work documents
- Prepare bid data folders and requests for bids / distribute to trades
- Review and Input bids in Bid Comparison tool
- Maintain Bid tracking spreadsheet / follow up consistently to ensure bids are received in a timely manner
- Answer request for information or obtain answers from fellow team members
- Analyze bids for accuracy
- Organize bids according to project and trade
- Take part in bid award meetings / responsible for keeping meeting notes and distributing action items
- Send out weekly project status report emails
- Prepare and distribute award letters

Contracting
- Develop Award folder with pertinent information and frequently requested items
- Obtain pertinent information from subs
- Maintain previously negotiated contracts (per contractor)
- Prepare and issue executable contract(s)
- File and organize executed contracts
- Input contracts into Buildtopia

Insurance
- Obtain insurance certificates from all contractors / ensure that policies meet required limits and are valid/in place.
Issue and obtain completed OCIP Enrollment forms from contractors. Review for completion and provide to OCIP policy manager
- Ensure that OCIP policy manager approves contractor into OCIP program 
- Calculate OCIP premium recapture and provide to accounting to ensure proper deductions are made
- Track projects hold OCIP policy manager accountable for issuing enrollment certificates

Purchase Orders
- Set up projects in Buildtopia Project Management Software
- Prepare Purchase orders for each new project
- Issue Purchase orders to each contractor
- Amend / issue new purchase orders based on charges to the original scope of work.
- To show you pay attention to detail, please add Welcome123 to the body of your response. 

Reporting
- Save and organize daily reports received from site superintendents
- Generate weekly and monthly reports from Buildtopia and distribute to field team
- Send weekly status reports on jobs out for bid include action items and pending items for discussion

Accounting
- Assist Accounting manager with maintaining general ledger. 
- Assist with transaction matching and reconciliation
- Perform research to determine property categorization of certain transactions

Finance
- Assist with comparative analysis of project costs
- Pull insights into future bidding criteria

Nice to haves
- Problem solving capabilities - will come up with some solution options before forwarding on a problem / question.
- Independent thinking

title: WordPress Developer
description:

Implement responsive design principles to ensure websites are mobile-friendly and accessible across all devices.

Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Experience
Strong proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, and MySQL.
Experience with custom WordPress theme and plugin development.
Familiarity with WordPress tools such as Gutenberg, Kadence Theme, Beaver Builder, and WooCommerce.
Knowledge of responsive design principles, version control systems (Git), and API integrations.
Proven ability to troubleshoot and resolve complex website issues.
Experience in providing customer support, with excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
A proactive approach to staying updated with the latest developments in WordPress and web development.

Regular Feedback and Recognition: We’ll provide regular feedback to help you grow and develop, and we’ll recognize and celebrate your successes as part of our team.

Employment Type
This is a full-time role, and we're not looking for an agency.

title: SEO Specialist
description:
COMPANY: MVP MAILHOUSE
Located in Park City, UT, MVP Mailhouse is a leader in direct marketing and analytics that drive ROI, specializing in the dental industry. Read more about MVP Mailhouse’s products and services on our flagship website: www.mvpmailhouse.com/.

MVP Mailhouse’s flagship product is direct mail marketing with unexpectedly advanced technology. We track all the phone calls and new customer conversations that our marketing campaigns generate for our customers and help them use that data to increase performance.

MVP Mailhouse uses proprietary technology including native mobile and web-based applications to make our customer experience more streamlined and effective.

TEAM: MARKETING
MVP Mailhouse uses a wide variety of marketing strategies and platforms to grow awareness and generate leads from both inbound and outbound marketing. The marketing team’s primary goal is to create and execute a marketing strategy that creates sales-qualified leads as cost-effectively as possible.

POSITION: SEO SPECIALIST
We are looking for a creative SEO Specialist to optimize the content on our website based on analytics and keyword research. The SEO Specialist is responsible for managing all SEO activities including but not limited to: content strategy, link building and keyword strategy. This skilled management is what we need in order to increase rankings on all major search networks.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Search Engine Basics: Understand search engine algorithms, indexing, crawling, and ranking processes to enhance site visibility.
- SERP Features: Utilize and optimize various search engine results page (SERP) features such as featured snippets, knowledge panels, and local packs.
- Keyword Identification: Research and select high-value keywords relevant to the website’s niche and audience.
- Search Intent: Analyze and interpret search queries to align content with informational, navigational, or transactional intent.
- Title Tags and Meta Descriptions: Create compelling and optimized titles and descriptions to boost click-through rates (CTR).
- Content Optimization: Develop and structure content with effective keyword usage, headings (H1, H2, etc.), and internal linking to enhance relevance and readability.
- Image Optimization: Optimize images with proper alt text, file names, and compression to improve search visibility and site performance.
- URL Structure: Design clean, keyword-rich URLs that are easily understood by search engines.
- Website Architecture: Ensure logical site structure to facilitate easy navigation and crawling.
- Schema Markup: Implement structured data to improve SERP appearance and enhance search engine understanding of content.
- XML Sitemaps and Robots.txt: Create and optimize sitemaps and robots.txt files to support effective indexing and crawling.
- Link Building: Develop and execute strategies for acquiring high-quality backlinks from reputable sources.
- Google Search Console: Monitor site performance, indexing status, and address issues using Google Search Console.
- Competitor Research: Analyze competitors’ SEO strategies, keyword targeting, and backlink profiles to identify opportunities and threats.
- Avoiding Black Hat Techniques: Avoid and educate on tactics that may lead to search engine penalties (e.g., keyword stuffing, cloaking, link schemes).
- Collaboration with Developers: Work effectively with developers to implement SEO strategies, particularly for sites built with Next.js or similar modern frameworks.

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATION:
- Proven SEO Experience: Demonstrated expertise in SEO techniques and best practices.
- Performance Marketing Knowledge: Solid understanding of performance marketing, conversion optimization, and online customer acquisition.
- Website Analytics: Proficiency with website analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, NetInsight, Omniture, WebTrends).
- A/B and Multivariate Testing: Experience with designing and analyzing A/B and multivariate experiments.
- Ranking Factors and Algorithms: Deep knowledge of search engine ranking factors and algorithms.
- Current Trends: Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO.
- Technical SEO Skills: Ability to work with web developers, especially on sites built with Next.js, to implement SEO improvements.
- Educational Background: BS/MS degree in a quantitative, test-driven field or related discipline.

DETAILS:
- Status: Freelance
- Work hours: US business hours (PH night shift)
- Location: Virtual team (work from home)

title: Property Management Maintenance
description:
The Property Management Maintenance Coordinator is responsible for overseeing and coordinating maintenance and repair services for a portfolio of single-family, condos, & townhome homes. This role ensures that all properties are well-maintained, and that tenants receive prompt, efficient service. The ideal candidate will possess excellent organizational and communication skills, have a strong understanding of property maintenance needs, and be able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

Key Responsibilities:
Maintenance Coordination:

Schedule, coordinate, and oversee all maintenance and repair work.
Communicate with tenants regarding maintenance requests, updates, and completion timelines.
Work with vendors and contractors to ensure timely and cost-effective repairs.
Review move in/move out evaluations and ensure issues are addressed. Send tenant quality completion survey. Ideally, get property in rent ready condition within 7 days of vacancy. 
Vendor Management:

Establish and maintain relationships with a network of reliable vendors and contractors.
Negotiate contracts and pricing to ensure quality work at competitive rates.
Review and approve invoices for completed work.
Tenant Communication:

Serve as the primary point of contact for tenants regarding maintenance issues.
Provide clear and timely communication to tenants about the status of their maintenance requests.
Address tenant concerns and complaints related to property maintenance promptly and professionally.

Communicate with Owners to discuss bids, options, pricing.

Ensure all maintenance activities comply with local, state, and federal regulations.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of EPA lead-based paint requirements and ensure all work is performed safely and in accordance with guidelines.
