title: Virtual Assistant (Scheduling, Sales, HR, and Finance)
description:
Are you a versatile and detail-oriented professional with excellent communication skills? Join our fast-growing, family-run service company based in California, USA! We’re looking for skilled Virtual Assistants to support various departments, including Scheduling, Sales, HR, and Finance.

Position: Depends on your fit
Work Hours: PST (Pacific Standard Time)

Your Role Includes (but is not limited to):

Scheduling:
- Manage and coordinate schedules for multiple teams and technicians
- Communicate with clients and team members to confirm appointments
- Handle rescheduling requests and cancellations efficiently
- Keep our scheduling system up-to-date and accurate

Sales:
- Handle inbound calls and emails from the Marketing Department and convert them into sales
- Make outbound follow-up calls to potential clients in your pipeline
- Record accurate information while listening to customers and asking probing questions
- Collaborate with the sales team to ensure a seamless sales process

HR:
- Assist with recruitment tasks, including posting job ads, screening resumes, and coordinating interviews
- Maintain employee records and assist with onboarding new hires
- Support the HR team with various administrative tasks as needed

Finance:
- Assist with basic bookkeeping tasks, including data entry and invoice processing
- Help manage accounts payable and receivable
- Support the Finance team with budget tracking and financial reporting

What We’re Looking For:
- A proactive and detail-oriented individual with strong multitasking abilities
- Previous experience in any of the listed departments (Scheduling, Sales, HR, or Finance)
- Excellent English communication skills are highly encouraged
- Familiarity with relevant software and tools (e.g., CRM for Sales, scheduling software, HR systems, accounting software) is a plus
- Ability to work independently and manage time effectively

Why Join Us?
- Full-time employees receive an HMO Package (Maxicare)
- We provide power supply backup (subject to manager’s approval)
- We’ll equip you with any software or technology you need (you’ll need to have your own computer and Wi-Fi to start)
- Be part of a rapidly growing team with opportunities for long-term employment
- Enjoy constant communication and support from ownership, management, and teammates
- Full-time employees receive a 13th-month bonus.

Interested in joining our team?
Please submit your contact information through our form at https://bit.ly/va-contact-form. **Only applicants who submit through the contact form will be entertained and receive the next steps for the application process. Applicants who don't know how to FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS will be automatically rejected - we're only looking for detail-oriented VAs**

Check us out to learn more about us @ kcpowerclean.com
Testimonials from current VAs are available.

title: Virtual Executive Assistant
description:
Who We Are

DSM Talent is the division that helps agency owners build a remote team in the Philippines by recruiting and managing amazing talent.

Who We're Looking For

We are seeking a dedicated and proactive Virtual Executive Assistant who excels in organizational tasks, thrives in a dynamic work environment, and is passionate about supporting executive operations. This is a full-time remote position ideal for someone with excellent people skills, integrity, attention to detail, and a proactive mindset.

Job Type: Full-Time Remote Position

Work Hours: 8 hours a day, 5 days a week (Night Shift: 9 AM - 5 PM PT Time) (11PM - 7AM PH Time)

Responsibilities

Calendar Management:

Schedule and coordinate meetings, production schedules, department video & graphics requests, and deadlines.

Manage calendars for meetings, shoots, and deadlines.

Document Management:

Create, edit, and manage documents, production schedules, and meeting notes.

Ensure all files are organized and accessible.

Correspondence Handling:

Draft and respond to emails and other communications on behalf of executives.

Screen phone calls and messages, directing them as appropriate.

Meeting Coordination:

Schedule and organize internal and external meetings, including preparing agendas and distributing materials.

Follow up on action items and deadlines from meetings.

Content Planning and Creation:

Develop and maintain a content calendar for social media posts, promotions, and updates.

Create and curate engaging content, including text, images, videos, and graphics.

Social Media Management:

Post content across various social media platforms (e.g., Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and YouTube).

Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and mentions in a timely manner.

Engagement Tracking and Reporting:

Track social media metrics and analytics to measure the effectiveness of posts and campaigns.

Prepare regular reports on social media performance, including key metrics and insights.

Campaign Coordination:

Plan and execute social media campaigns, including paid advertisements and promotions.

Collaborate with the production team to align content with current projects and campaigns.

Community and Trend Management:

Address and resolve any issues or negative feedback from the online community.

Stay updated on social media trends, best practices, and platform changes.

Compliance:

Ensure that all social media activities comply with company policies and legal requirements.

Manage any legal or copyright issues related to social media content.

Project Management:

Implement and utilize project management tools to track social media and video production tasks.

Monitor project progress and ensure regular updates and status reports.

Resource Allocation:

Allocate resources and set deadlines for campaigns and video shoots.

Adjust resource allocation based on project demands.

Process Improvement:

Continuously improve workflows for social media and video production.

Develop and manage budgets for social media campaigns and video production.

Training and Onboarding:

Assist in onboarding new team members and provide training on tools and processes.

Support mentorship and provide technical assistance as needed.

Confidentiality and Discretion:

Handle sensitive information with the utmost confidentiality and discretion.

Ensure compliance with company policies and legal requirements.

Experience

Organizational Skills: Proven ability to manage multiple tasks, schedules, and priorities efficiently.

Communication Skills: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills for effective collaboration.

Technical Proficiency: Expertise in office software (e.g., Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace), scheduling tools (e.g., Outlook), and project management software (e.g., Asana, ClickUp or Notion).

Attention to Detail: Keen eye for accuracy in tasks and documents.

Proactive Problem-Solving: Experience in anticipating potential issues and implementing solutions proactively.

Confidentiality Management: Demonstrated ability to handle sensitive information discreetly and maintain confidentiality.

Adaptability: Flexibility and quick thinking to adjust to changing priorities and fast-paced environments.

Project Coordination: Background in coordinating projects, ensuring timelines are met, and facilitating communication between team members.

Relationship Building: Evidence of building strong relationships with team members, both internal and external.

Stress Management: Ability to work effectively in high-stress environments with tight deadlines.

Creative Thinking: Innovative ideas for content creation and problem-solving.

Reliability: Dependable and trustworthy, maintaining integrity in all tasks.

Leadership Support: Direct experience in supporting executives or high-level management.

How We Will Help You Succeed

Ongoing Training: Stay at the forefront of your role. We offer regular training sessions to ensure you're updated on the latest tools and best practices.

Supportive Environment: Our team is globally dispersed yet tight-knit. We believe in collaboration and will always be there to assist and guide.

Open Communication: We maintain a transparent work environment. Regular check-ins and feedback sessions are scheduled to ensure alignment with organizational goals and to offer support.

State-of-the-art Tools: To ensure your tasks run smoothly, we'll provide you access to the best tools and platforms in the industry.

Employment Type

This is a full-time role, and we're not looking for an agency.

Please add the words "Ramen" at the beginning of... Why are you interested in this position?

Salary Range: Php 40,000 - 50,000

Apply here: https://form.smartsuite.com/sda8aofo/P1tL4Y2cNU

title: Control Systems Engineer
description:
About Us: 

Automation Contractors is dedicated to delivering high-quality services to the biopharmaceutical, construction, and manufacturing sectors. Our mission is to tailor each project to meet our clients' needs using industry best practices and timely execution. With our team's extensive experience and expertise, we develop comprehensive solutions for engineering, validation, and support. 

Job Summary: 

We are seeking a skilled Control Systems Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will design, develop, test, and maintain control systems that ensure seamless operation of equipment and processes. You will collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, including mechanical, electrical, and software engineers, to implement innovative control solutions that enhance efficiency, safety, and performance. 

Key Responsibilities: 

Design and develop control systems for new and existing equipment, including PLC, SCADA, DCS, and HMI systems. 

Create control algorithms, logic diagrams, and user interfaces to automate processes. 

Program and configure PLCs, DCS, SCADA, and HMI systems for automated equipment and process control. 

Conduct system integration, testing, and commissioning to ensure proper installation and functionality. 

Troubleshoot and optimize control systems to enhance efficiency and minimize downtime. 

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define system requirements, specifications, and deliverables. 

Develop and maintain technical documentation, including system designs, user manuals, and operation guides. 

Provide technical support and training to end-users and maintenance teams. 

Stay current with industry trends, technologies, and best practices in control systems engineering. 



Qualifications: 

Proven experience in control systems design, programming, and implementation. 

Preferred qualifications in networking and IT. 

Experience with AutoCAD Electrical is a plus. 

Proficiency in programming PLCs (e.g., Siemens, Allen Bradley, Schneider Electric) and familiarity with SCADA, DCS, and HMI systems. 

Strong understanding of process control theory, PID tuning, and instrumentation. 

Experience with industrial communication protocols (e.g., Modbus, Profibus, Ethernet/IP). 

Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and attention-to-detail skills. 

Strong communication and teamwork abilities. 

Knowledge of safety standards (e.g., SIL, IEC 61508) and experience with safety instrumented systems is advantageous. 

Work Schedule: 

Full-time availability is required from 8 AM - 5 PM EST. 

Technical Requirements: 

A reliable high-speed internet connection is essential. 

Compensation: 

Hourly rate is competitive and based on experience, typically ranging from $6-$10 per hour. 

Payment: 

Payments are processed via PayPal. 


Benefits: 

Competitive compensation based on experience and qualifications. 

Opportunity for professional growth within an innovative and forward-thinking company. 

Remote work environment with a collaborative and supportive team culture. 

Training and development opportunities for the right candidate. 

If you are a motivated Control Systems Engineer looking for a challenging role with a dynamic team, we encourage you to apply!

title: Senior IT Product Manager
description:
JC Management

JC Management is currently seeking an IT Product Manager with a robust technical background and strong project management skills. This role demands a strategic thinker who can oversee the development and enhancement of our digital products, ensuring they meet our business objectives and customer needs. The ideal candidate will have a strong grasp of Agile methodologies and experience leading both developer and UI/UX teams.
Key Responsibilities

Define and communicate product vision and strategy to all relevant stakeholders.
Manage the product lifecycle from concept through development, launch, and iteration.
Lead and coordinate cross-functional teams, including developers and UI/UX designers, to ensure timely delivery of product features.
Plan and oversee the product architecture, ensuring it meets both current and future needs.
Write and maintain detailed documentation and project plans.
Apply Agile methodologies to manage project progress and resolve any issues that arise.
Analyze market trends and user feedback to continuously improve the product offerings.
Conduct regular team meetings to ensure alignment, discuss project updates, and gather team input.
Serve as the primary liaison between technical teams and other departments, including marketing and customer support, to ensure product goals are met.
Prepare and present regular reports on product development progress to senior management.

Minimum Requirements

At least 5 years of managerial experience in a product management role.
Proven experience leading development and UI/UX teams.
Strong knowledge of Agile project management methodologies.
Proficient in React.js, Node.js, Python, and frameworks such as Django and MongoDB.
Experience in writing technical documentation and planning architecture.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Nice to Have

Experience in writing smart contracts and developing blockchain technologies.

What We Offer

A pivotal role in shaping the future of IT product development at JC Management.
Opportunities to work on cutting-edge technologies and innovative projects.
A dynamic and supportive work environment that fosters professional growth and development.
Competitive compensation and benefits package.

Application Process

Candidates are encouraged to submit a comprehensive resume detailing their experience in product management, along with any relevant certifications or accomplishments. Links to past projects or portfolios that demonstrate your expertise in managing technical teams and developing products are highly appreciated.

How to Apply: Please send your application, Including your resume, cover letter, and any supporting documentation or links that reflect your qualifications and experience as an IT Product Manager.

This position offers the chance to lead, innovate, and excel in a thriving environment at JC Management. We are eager to welcome a visionary IT Product Manager to our team, someone who is ready to drive our products to the forefront of the industry.

title: Head of IT / Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
description:
JC Management

JC Management is seeking a visionary and experienced Head of IT/CTO to lead our technology department. The ideal candidate will be an expert full-stack developer with profound knowledge in React.js, Node.js, Python, and frameworks like Django and MongoDB. This role is pivotal in driving our tech strategy and ensuring the development and delivery of high-quality web platforms and applications that align with our business goals.
Key Responsibilities

Lead, manage, and scale JC Management’s IT and development teams, ensuring efficient project execution and team performance.
Conduct job interviews and make hiring decisions to strengthen the team with top-tier talent.
Oversee the development of web platforms and applications, ensuring they meet our specifications and quality standards.
Define and direct the company’s technology strategy and roadmap, collaborating with other department heads to ensure alignment with overall business objectives.
Manage technology budgets and timelines, ensuring resources are allocated effectively to maximize innovation and efficiency.
Implement best practices for software development and documentation, ensuring solutions are scalable, secure, and maintainable.
Stay abreast of emerging technology trends and IT best practices, integrating them into plans and processes where beneficial.
Ensure the security of all technology systems and compliance with data protection regulations.
Develop and oversee a dynamic technology architecture that supports the growing needs of the business.
Facilitate technology training and mentoring for team members to foster a culture of continuous learning and development.

Minimum Requirements

Proven experience as a full-stack developer, with strong competencies in React.js, Node.js, Python, Django, and MongoDB.
At least 5 years of experience in software development and 2 years in a managerial position.
Fluent or bilingual proficiency in English.
Demonstrable experience in leading and scaling IT teams.
Experience in writing smart contracts and developing blockchain technologies is highly desirable.

Nice to Have

Experience in writing smart contracts and developing blockchain technologies.

What We Offer

A leadership role at the forefront of technology within a growing company.
Opportunities to implement your vision and impact the future of technology in business.
Competitive compensation and benefits package.
A dynamic and innovative work environment.

Application Process:

Interested candidates should submit their resume along with links to any relevant online profiles, such as GitHub, or contributions to open-source projects that showcase your involvement and expertise.

How to Apply: Please answer this application, Including your resume, cover letter, and links to your GitHub portfolio or relevant projects that demonstrate your technical capabilities and leadership experience.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a seasoned professional looking to lead and inspire a team of developers while steering the technological innovations at JC Management. We look forward to discovering how you can contribute to our future successes.

title: Senior System/Network Admin
description:

title: Web Developer for Cryptocurrency-Enabled Donation Website
description:
Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced web developer to design and build a user-friendly donation website. The ideal candidate will have expertise in integrating various payment gateways, with a strong emphasis on cryptocurrency payments. This platform will serve as a hub for supporters to contribute to our cause.

Key Responsibilities: 

Develop a responsive and visually appealing donation website.
Integrate secure payment processing options, including credit/debit cards and popular cryptocurrencies (Bitcoin, Ethereum, etc.).
Implement a user-friendly interface for donors to easily navigate and complete transactions.
Ensure the website is compliant with all relevant regulations regarding online donations and cryptocurrency transactions.
Optimize the website for SEO and performance.
Provide ongoing maintenance and support as needed.
Qualifications: 

Proven experience in web development (3+ years).
Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and a back-end language (PHP, Python, etc.).
Familiarity with cryptocurrency payment gateways (e.g., Coinbase Commerce, BitPay) and financial transaction security.
Experience with website CMS platforms (WordPress, Joomla, etc.) is a plus.
Strong attention to detail and the ability to troubleshoot issues efficiently.
Excellent communication skills and ability to work independently.
To Apply:
Please submit your resume, a cover letter, and examples of previous work (especially relevant projects) to [Your Contact Email]. In your cover letter, include your experience with cryptocurrency payment systems and your approach to building donation websites.

Deadline for Applications: [Insert Deadline]

If you're passionate about making a difference and have the skills to help us achieve our goals, we want to hear from you!

title: Technical Program Manager (SAAS)
description:
Skills play a vital role in a workforce but We believe that hiring character over skill is the basic foundation for building a smart, efficient, passionate, driven, and impactful workforce.

AT MERIDIAN, WE FOCUS ON PEOPLE OVER PROFITS

Our flexible work model provides a healthy, safe, and open work culture that empowers our TeamMates.!

We’re seeking a highly skilled and motivated Staff Technical Program Manager to join our team. Our Technical Program Managers are responsible for leading cross-functional programs to deliver high-quality, scalable products. We place a strong emphasis on start-to-finish ownership, collaboration, and inclusivity. If you’re passionate about technology, enjoy managing complex projects, and have a knack for bringing cross-functional teams together, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

- Leads extremely complex programs with no supervision on ambiguous, adaptive programs
- Demonstrates expert skills in getting things done through others. Influencing without authority.
- In partnership with the program leads, defines team governance and control on their programs or projects.
- Collaborates with senior leaders and cross-functional stakeholders to negotiate trade-offs, balance technical and customer facing needs, and deliver crisp and clear communication to ensure alignment or escalation as needed.
- Proactively identifies and manages project risks, issues, and dependencies, and implements mitigation strategies.
- Drives continuous improvement in delivery, team collaboration, processes and methodologies to improve cross-functional team collaboration and deliver of customer value.
- Leads and mentors cross-functional peers and partners on the value and use of frameworks and methodologies.
- Recognized as an knowledgeable partner and go-to person by their portfolio stakeholders and team(s
- Leads and coaches others in all agile ceremonies without supervision
- Demonstrates and evangelizes Agile values and principles, coaching teams on Agile culture and techniques.
- Mentors and coaches team members on best practices to help grow the program management acumen
- Leads proactive identification and mitigation of issues and risks. Leverages experience to anticipate risks in advance of impacts.
- Stays current on industry trends and serves as an expert in product development practices, the software development lifecycle, and agile engineering practices. Is advocating, coaching, and mentoring.

Qualifications:

- BS/BA degree or higher or equivalent technical experience in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems (CIS), or Management Information Systems (MIS)
- 10+ of proven experience as a Technical Program Manager or similar role in a fast-paced software engineering environment. Start-up experience preferred.
- 10+ years of experience assembling and managing cross-functional schedules and risk plans in an agile environment (Scrum of Scrums experience a plus).
- 5+ years of experience with Jira and Confluence, including Jira and Confluence administration experience
- Technical fluency is expected; comfort understanding and discussing technology concepts, driving tradeoffs and new opportunities with engineering team members.
- Strong understanding of software development methodologies and technical concepts.
- Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
- Problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
- Proficiency in project management tools and software.
- Experience with experimentation tools and methodology a plus
- Preferred Certified Scrum Master, (CSM) and/or SAFe certification

Bonus Qualifications:

- Experience with Event Storming Process
- Experience with Event Based architecture
- Experience with SQL
- Domain-driven design knowledge

title: Technical Program Manager
description:
Skills play a vital role in a workforce but We believe that hiring character over skill is the basic foundation for building a smart, efficient, passionate, driven, and impactful workforce.

AT MERIDIAN, WE FOCUS ON PEOPLE OVER PROFITS

Our flexible work model provides a healthy, safe, and open work culture that empowers our TeamMates.!

We’re seeking a highly skilled and motivated Staff Technical Program Manager to join our team. Our Technical Program Managers are responsible for leading cross-functional programs to deliver high-quality, scalable products. We place a strong emphasis on start-to-finish ownership, collaboration, and inclusivity. If you’re passionate about technology, enjoy managing complex projects, and have a knack for bringing cross-functional teams together, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

- Leads extremely complex programs with no supervision on ambiguous, adaptive programs
- Demonstrates expert skills in getting things done through others. Influencing without authority.
- In partnership with the program leads, defines team governance and control on their programs or projects.
- Collaborates with senior leaders and cross-functional stakeholders to negotiate trade-offs, balance technical and customer facing needs, and deliver crisp and clear communication to ensure alignment or escalation as needed.
- Proactively identifies and manages project risks, issues, and dependencies, and implements mitigation strategies.
- Drives continuous improvement in delivery, team collaboration, processes and methodologies to improve cross-functional team collaboration and deliver of customer value.
- Leads and mentors cross-functional peers and partners on the value and use of frameworks and methodologies.
- Recognized as an knowledgeable partner and go-to person by their portfolio stakeholders and team(s
- Leads and coaches others in all agile ceremonies without supervision
- Demonstrates and evangelizes Agile values and principles, coaching teams on Agile culture and techniques.
- Mentors and coaches team members on best practices to help grow the program management acumen
- Leads proactive identification and mitigation of issues and risks. Leverages experience to anticipate risks in advance of impacts.
- Stays current on industry trends and serves as an expert in product development practices, the software development lifecycle, and agile engineering practices. Is advocating, coaching, and mentoring.

Qualifications:

- BS/BA degree or higher or equivalent technical experience in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Information Systems (CIS), or Management Information Systems (MIS)
- 10+ of proven experience as a Technical Program Manager or similar role in a fast-paced software engineering environment. Start-up experience preferred.
- 10+ years of experience assembling and managing cross-functional schedules and risk plans in an agile environment (Scrum of Scrums experience a plus).
- 5+ years of experience with Jira and Confluence, including Jira and Confluence administration experience
- Technical fluency is expected; comfort understanding and discussing technology concepts, driving tradeoffs and new opportunities with engineering team members.
- Strong understanding of software development methodologies and technical concepts.
- Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
- Problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
- Proficiency in project management tools and software.
- Experience with experimentation tools and methodology a plus
- Preferred Certified Scrum Master, (CSM) and/or SAFe certification

Bonus Qualifications:

- Experience with Event Storming Process
- Experience with Event Based architecture
- Experience with SQL
- Domain-driven design knowledge

title: Bilingual (Spanish-English Speaker) VAs
description:
Location: Work from Home
Type of Employment: Full-time
Work shift: USA Business Hours


FOR Property Managers

Property Maintenance: Oversee maintenance and repair activities, ensuring properties are well-maintained and issues are promptly resolved.
Tenant Relations: Act as the primary point of contact for tenants, addressing their concerns and needs, and ensuring high levels of tenant satisfaction.
Leasing and Marketing: Manage the leasing process, including advertising vacancies, showing properties, screening applicants, and preparing lease agreements.
Financial Management: Oversee the financial performance of the properties, including budgeting, rent collection, expense management, and financial reporting.
Compliance: Ensure properties comply with local, state, and federal regulations, including safety standards and fair housing laws.
Vendor Management: Negotiate and manage contracts with service providers, including maintenance, landscaping, security, and cleaning services.
Record Keeping: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of property transactions, tenant information, maintenance activities, and financial reports.
Tenant Communication: Handle tenant inquiries and follow up on maintenance requests in both Spanish and English. 

FOR Cold Callers

Prospecting: Identify and contact potential clients via cold calling to generate leads and set appointments for property showings.
Client Interaction: Communicate effectively with prospective clients in both Spanish and English, providing information about available properties and answering questions.
Database Management: Maintain and update a database of potential clients, tracking interactions and follow-up activities.
Lead Generation: Develop and implement strategies for lead generation and client acquisition.
Follow-Up: Follow up with potential clients who have expressed interest in the properties, ensuring a high conversion rate.

Qualifications

Education: High school diploma or equivalent; additional education in real estate, business administration, or a related field is a plus.
Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience in property management, real estate, customer service, or sales.
Language Proficiency: Fluency in both Spanish and English, with strong written and verbal communication skills in both languages.
Skills: Proficiency in property management software, Microsoft Office Suite, and CRM systems.
Certifications: Relevant real estate certifications are a plus.
Knowledge: Understanding of property management laws and regulations, leasing processes, and cold calling techniques.

Personal Attributes

Detail-Oriented: High attention to detail and accuracy in managing property-related tasks and client interactions.
Organized: Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines.
Communicative: Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, in Spanish and English, with the ability to interact with tenants, clients, and team members.
Proactive: Self-motivated and proactive in identifying and resolving issues.
Customer-Focused: Strong commitment to providing excellent customer service to tenants and potential clients.
Persistent: Ability to handle rejection and maintain a positive attitude during cold calling activities.

Benefits:

Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.
Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company.
A supportive and inclusive work environment that values diversity and teamwork.


HOW TO APPLY: 

Apply through our career page - https://www.careers-page.com/our-assistants/job/L6895V6W

***Only application sent through our career page will be considered***

title: C# Developer with .NET and SQL Server Expertise
description: We are seeking a highly skilled C# developer with a strong background in the .NET framework and SQL Server to join our project on a freelance basis. You will assist in developing a comprehensive project management system for the construction industry, automating various processes including monthly payment applications and database management. Responsibilities include collaborating in design and development, setting up SQL Server databases, developing automation scripts, and providing mentorship in C#. Freelance rates are competitive and based on experience.

title: No-Code Automation Contractor
description:
No-Code Automation Specialist Needed for Rapid Invoice Processing System Development

Are you a no-code automation expert who can work fast and efficiently? 

We need your skills to quickly revolutionise our client's invoice processing system. This short-term gig has the potential to evolve into a full-time role for the right candidate.

Project Overview:

- Develop a no-code automated system that allows our client to upload documents, extract relevant data, and create a draft CSV file compatible with Xero accounting software. This solution will save our client several hours per week.

Key Responsibilities:

- Rapidly design and implement a no-code automation workflow primarily using Make.com (formerly Integromat) and Zapier
- Integrate Carrd for document uploads
- Develop data extraction and processing logic without coding
- Create an efficient system to generate draft CSV files for Xero
- Implement error handling and data validation

Required Skills and Experience:

- Proven experience with no-code automation platforms, especially Make.com (formerly Integromat) and Zapier
- Familiarity with Carrd for web form creation
- Understanding of OCR and data extraction techniques
- Experience with CSV file generation and manipulation
- Knowledge of Xero accounting software (preferred)
- Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
- Excellent communication and documentation abilities
- Ability to work quickly and efficiently under tight deadlines

Bonus Skills:

- Experience with AI-powered document processing
- Familiarity with webhook integrations

Compensation:

- Competitive hourly pay based on experience. We value skill and efficiency and are willing to compensate accordingly.

Project Timeframe:

- We're looking for a quick turnaround on this project. Ideal candidates should be able to complete the task within a few days.
Future Opportunities:

Potential for ongoing optimisation and maintenance work
Opportunity to transition to a full-time role

If you're passionate about creating efficient no-code automation solutions and have the skills to turn complex processes into streamlined workflows quickly, we want to hear from you!
Please submit your application with:

- Your relevant experience with Make.com, Zapier, and similar no-code projects
- Your immediate availability and hourly rate expectations

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Do you have experience in ServiceTitan software? Customer service? Are you looking for a full-time work-from-home opportunity? If you answered all yes, then we invite you to apply!

Position Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented and customer-focused individual to join our team as a Customer Service Representative. The ideal candidate will have prior experience with ServiceTitan and a passion for providing top-notch customer support. You will be the first point of contact for our clients, addressing their needs and ensuring a positive experience with our services.

Key Responsibilities:

Respond promptly to customer inquiries via phone, email, and chat.
Use ServiceTitan to manage and track customer interactions, appointments, and service requests.
Provide accurate information about our products and services.
Troubleshoot and resolve customer issues efficiently.
Maintain detailed records of customer interactions and transactions in ServiceTitan.
Collaborate with other departments to ensure customer satisfaction.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and share feedback with management.
Uphold the company’s commitment to high-quality customer service.

Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Customer Service Representative or similar role.
Proficiency in using ServiceTitan software is required.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
High level of empathy and customer-focused mindset.
Ability to multitask and manage time effectively.

How to Apply:

Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume to rosie@affirmdata.com . Please include “Customer Service Representative – ServiceTitan” in the subject line.

title: Collections / Payments Coordinator (Real Estate)
description:
Nautical Staffing is looking for an experienced Payments Coordinator for our US-based client in the real estate and property management and industry.

Responsibilities:
• Make collection calls to customers to collect on past due accounts
• Proactively communicate with customers to ensure timely payment
• Correspond by emails, phone calls, and letters with internal and external customers to resolve errors in accounts, investigate complaints, verify accuracy of charges, and collect past due balances
• Research unapplied cash to identify invoices for which payment was intended or refund, to be determined on a case-by-case basis
• Research short pays, working with both the external customer and internally with the customer representative
• Escalate collection matters to management that are unable to be resolved
• Support annual and ad-hoc audit requests, as needed
• Check occupancy of tenants
• Help property managers with transfer of info to new owner/manager when a building sells and has subsidy tenants
• Monitor and track accounts receivable, review information for accuracy and ensure that all relevant information is correct and in accordance with departmental and Firm policies and guidelines
• Work with partners in the management of their accounts receivable, keeping them abreast of potential collection issues
• Maintain contact with key personnel to resolve discrepancies and ensure prompt payment
• Work cooperatively with the billing department to resolve issues with invoices submitted electronically
• Research and analyze collection issues, coordinate with appropriate personnel to identify, and resolve further aging of delinquent balances; contact clients according to firm policy regarding accounts
• Research and respond to inquiries and assist with resolutions in a timely manner
• Perform analysis, identify, and help to resolve exposures and issues, communicate findings to manager
• Assist with special projects as needed and other miscellaneous duties as assigned

Qualifications:
• Prior experience in collections / accounts receivable is strictly required
• Excellent math and MS Excel / Google Sheets skills are required
• Strong communication skills are required
• Experience in the US real estate and property management industry is highly preferred
• Degree in Accounting or Business Administration is preferred
• Familiarity with lien releases, preliminary notices, and aging reports is preferred
• Strong reconciliation skills are preferred
• Experience working with Yardi is preferred
• Must be willing to work full-time during US Central business hours

Instructions:
1) Send a link to your updated CV (include it in your message)
2) Explain your experience in collections in 1 short paragraph
3) Use the subject: “Polaris - Payments Coordinator”

title: LinkedIn Lead Generation
description:
Job Overview:

We are looking for an experienced LinkedIn Lead Generation specialist (at least 3 or more years of relevant and direct experience) who is highly skilled in email scraping, lead generation, list enhancements, etc. 

The ideal candidate must have proven experience using LinkedIn for lead generation and email scraping tools. If you do not have hands-on experience with these skills, please do not apply.

This position is for someone who can work independently, meet deadlines, and deliver accurate and verified leads. You will be responsible for identifying potential clients and collecting their contact information (mainly emails) through LinkedIn and other reliable tools.


Key Responsibilities:

- Lead Generation on LinkedIn: Finding potential clients based on given criteria (industry, job title, location, etc.).
- Email Scraping: Extracting valid and verified emails using email scraping tools and techniques.
- Data Entry: Organizing and updating the collected data in Google Sheets or Excel files.
- Data Verification: Ensuring that all contact information (especially emails) is accurate and valid.
- Reporting: Provide daily/weekly updates on lead generation progress.


Requirements:

- Proven experience with LinkedIn scraping and lead generation (MUST provide examples of previous work).
- Familiarity with email scraping tools (e.g., Hunter.io, Skrapp, Snov.io, etc.).
- Basic knowledge of Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel.
- Attention to detail: Ability to verify and ensure accurate data.
- Great English communication skills (written and spoken).
- Strong ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
- Problem solver: you can identify and solve problems and generate ideas that help the company and its clients.


Note:

This position is ideal for a self motivated and productive person who loves to find leads and offer ideas and solutions for this specific use case. 

Hours TBD.

title: Operations Coordinator - HVAC/Refrigeration
description:
***PLEASE DO NOT APPLY FOR THIS POSITION IF YOU DO NOT HAVE EXPERIENCE IN THE HEATING, VENTILATION, AIR CONDITIONING, AND REFRIGERATION INDUSTRY***

Our company is a leader in HVAC/R predictive maintenance and management for small commercial buildings. They offer a unique pairing of software and services to save customers money on emergency repairs and energy bills. The technology leverages smart sensors and artificial intelligence to detect HVAC and Refrigeration issues early, and they work with a preferred network of qualified contractors to fix these issues before they lead to system failure.

About the Position:
We are seeking to hire an Operations Coordinator.

The Coordinator partners with the network of contractors and internal teams to deliver exceptional customer service experiences. The coordinator is responsible for taking inbound calls from customers and assisting them to the best of their ability. The role requires prior customer service experience, with a proven ability to multi-task and speak to and assist a wide range of customers.

This role presents an amazing opportunity to step up to an impactful, high-growth role and take on the following responsibilities:

-Manage daily scheduling and support of contractors, emergency repair requests, maintenance visits, and other HVAC/R projects
-Answer customer and contractor inquiries by phone, text, email, and web in a timely manner
-Enter and manage work orders, jobs, and clients on a dispatch board using established processes
-Issue purchase orders for service
-Process payments
-Manage customer concerns and work to resolve them efficiently and effectively

Requirements:
-Excellent English communication skills: verbal, written, and reading - MUST
-HVAC industry experience - MUST
-Experience in customer service with a strong commitment to customer happiness and satisfaction
-Experience problem-solving to meet customer needs
-Strong computer skills
-Ability to learn new technology, share knowledge, and provide feedback to improve our company's internal processes
-Ability to work independently and in a team setting
-Ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment and excellent time management skills
-A positive, can-do attitude and eagerness for continuous improvement
-Experience with Zoho tools (Zoho desk, Zoho books, CRM) - ADVANTAGE

Work Schedule:
-This is a full-time position in a work-from-home setup. You will be working 8 hours a day, 5 days a week.


TO APPLY FOR THIS POSITION, FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW:
1. Include the phrase "HVAC" in your SUBJECT.
2. Send a COVER LETTER with a LINK to your CV/Resume.

***APPLICATIONS WITHOUT CVS/RESUMES WILL NOT BE CONSIDERED***

title: Appointment Setter for Startups
description:
Join Huzzle’s Talent Pool as an Appointment Setter! 

At Huzzle, we connect top-tier Appointment Setters & SDRs with leading companies across the UK, US, and Europe. Whether it’s a startup, scale-up, agency, or enterprise, our clients trust us to find the best talent. We only admit the top 3% of candidates into our talent pool, ensuring they are matched with exclusive, long-term opportunities. Unlike an outsourcing agency, we place you directly with a client where you’re hired in-house to work full-time as a valued member of their team.

WHO THIS IS FOR:
You're looking to:
• Work with top-tier clients in the industry and secure long-term, stable opportunities.
• Advance your career through access to exclusive roles and ongoing professional development.
• Be valued and respected for your skills and contributions in a supportive work environment.
• Earn a competitive salary with regular pay increases and success-based bonuses.
• Stop fighting for opportunities across different platforms, and let us match you with roles where we believe you'll excel.

And if you're:
• Tired of job-hopping and want a stable, long-term position.
• Frustrated by lack of support or training in previous roles.
• Looking for meaningful work where your contributions are recognized and rewarded.
• Eager to work full-time for a reputable company that values your expertise.

What We Offer:
Competitive Pay: Starting at 30K PHP/month with regular pay raises and success-based bonuses:
• Month 1: 30K PHP/month + bonus
• Month 3: 33K PHP/month + bonus
• Month 6: 36K PHP/month + bonus
• Month 9: 38K PHP/month + bonus
Exclusive Access: Work with top companies and enjoy long-term client relationships.
Work from Anywhere: Enjoy the flexibility of working remotely, from the comfort of your home.

Your Role as an Appointment Setter:
• Proactive Outreach: Engage potential clients and partners through phone, email, and social media platforms.
• Seamless Scheduling: Coordinate meetings and manage calendars for the sales teams, ensuring a smooth experience for both the team and potential clients.
• CRM Mastery: Keep meticulous records of all interactions, appointments, and follow-up activities in a CRM system.
• Database Management: Regularly update and review the contact database to maintain accuracy and relevancy.
• Active Communication: Collaborate with sales and marketing to understand offerings and effectively communicate the value proposition.
• Optimize & Succeed: Monitor appointment success rates and work closely with the team to refine strategies for higher conversions.
• Industry Savvy: Stay updated on industry trends to engage clients effectively and address their needs.


Who We're Looking For:
• Experience: At least 1 years of experience with Appointment Setting, Cold Calling, and Outbound Messaging (LinkedIn, Cold Emails).
• Sales Tools Proficiency: Familiarity with relevant sales and outreach tools (CRMs, Prospecting Tools, Automation Tools, etc).
• Communication Skills: Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport with clients.
• Organizational Skills: Excellent time management and the ability to juggle multiple schedules.
• Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in Google Docs, Google Sheets, CRM systems, and communication tools like Slack, ChatGPT, Zoom, and LinkedIn.
• Remote Ready: Able to work effectively in a remote environment with a reliable laptop and internet connection.
• Detail-Oriented: A keen eye for detail and a commitment to maintaining high-quality data in systems.

Our Hiring Process:
• Step 1: Screening Interview
• Step 2: Take-home Task
• Step 3: Successful candidates are admitted to our talent pool, gaining access to exclusive opportunities.
• Step 4: We match you with a client for a final interview.

Application Requirements:
1. Make sure the Subject of the application is the name of the Capital City of Canada otherwise your application won't be reviewed.
2. Share your Resume/CV and any relevant experience / projects you've worked on.
3. Send anything else that can set you apart!

title: Walmart Product Research and Analytics Tool Developer
description:
Here's an updated job description that includes developing a tool with functionalities similar to Keepa as well:
Job Title: Walmart Product Research and Analytics Tool Developer
Location: Remote
About Us:
We are a dynamic team focused on e-commerce and marketplace optimization. Our mission is to develop a comprehensive tool that combines the product research capabilities similar to SellerAmp with the price and sales analytics features akin to Keepa, specifically tailored for Walmart sellers. This tool will empower sellers by providing deep insights into product performance, pricing trends, and market dynamics on the Walmart platform.
Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced and innovative software developer to lead the creation of a cutting-edge tool for Walmart sellers. The tool will combine functionalities for advanced product research, profit calculation, and detailed price tracking and sales analytics. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in web development, data analysis, and experience with e-commerce platforms, particularly Walmart.
Responsibilities:
- Tool Development: Design, develop, and implement a web-based tool that provides comprehensive product research, pricing analytics, and sales tracking for Walmart sellers.
- Profit Calculation Engine: Develop an algorithm to calculate potential profits, taking into account product cost, Walmart fees, shipping costs, and other relevant factors.
- Market and Pricing Analysis: Create features to analyze product listings for sales rank estimations, competitor analysis, pricing trends, and demand forecasting, similar to SellerAmp.
- Price and Sales History Tracking: Implement a functionality like Keepa that tracks and visualizes historical price changes, sales ranks, and other key metrics over time on Walmart.
- Integration and Compatibility: Ensure seamless integration with web browsers and create a mobile-friendly version for on-the-go product research and analysis.
- User Interface Design: Develop a user-friendly interface that presents complex data in a clear, actionable format.
- Data Scraping and API Integration: Implement robust data scraping techniques and API integrations to pull real-time data from Walmart.
- Alerts and Notifications: Develop a system for notifying users about significant changes in product prices, sales ranks, inventory levels, or competition dynamics.
- Testing and Quality Assurance: Conduct rigorous testing to ensure the tool is accurate, reliable, and easy to use.
- Continuous Improvement: Gather user feedback and continuously improve the tool’s functionality and performance.
Requirements:
- Experience: Minimum of 3 years in software development, with a focus on e-commerce tools, data analytics, or similar applications.
- Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, JavaScript, or similar. Experience with web development frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js) and backend technologies (e.g., Node.js, Django, Flask).
- Data Handling: Strong experience in data scraping, API integration, and data manipulation. Experience with creating data visualizations and tracking historical data.
- Knowledge of Walmart Marketplace: Familiarity with Walmart’s marketplace, seller dynamics, product listing strategies, and pricing algorithms.
- Problem Solving: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
- Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills to collaborate effectively with team members and stakeholders.
- Adaptability: Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.
Preferred Qualifications:
- Experience in developing similar tools for Amazon, Walmart, or other e-commerce platforms.
- Familiarity with machine learning algorithms for data prediction and trend analysis.
- Knowledge of UX/UI best practices.
- Experience with creating historical data tracking tools similar to Keepa.
What We Offer:
- Competitive salary based on experience.
- Opportunity to work remotely with a flexible schedule.
- A collaborative and innovative work environment.
- The chance to be part of a cutting-edge project that will shape the future of e-commerce on Walmart.
How to Apply:
Please submit your resume, a cover letter detailing your relevant experience, and examples of previous projects or tools you have developed to [Your Email Address].
---
Feel free to adjust the description based on your specific requirements!

Job Summary:

As an Experienced Property Manager/Leasing Coordinator, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing property management operations and driving leasing activities for our portfolio of properties. • Proficiency in using Buildium, CINC, AppFolio, etc or similar property management software.
• Strong knowledge of leasing procedures, fair housing laws, and landlord-tenant regulations.
• Excellent communication and customer service skills, with the ability to build rapport with tenants, property owners, and team members.
• Detail-oriented and organized, with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.

Additionally, Kathy Kuo Home provides its Trade customers with a dedicated concierge team to ensure a best-in-class customer service experience throughout the entire design process. Combining service, commerce, and technology, Kathy Kuo Home is the ultimate one-stop home and design destination.
We are currently seeking a Mid-to-Senior level .Net Developer to grow with our familial on-site NYC team and take an active role in the nonstop development of our business. We need your ideas and your passion for great code! An entrepreneurial mind is also key as we build, improve and provide innovative solutions to our site utilizing C#, ASP.Net, MVC 5, JavaScript/JQuery, MySQL and Windows Server. You'll also have the opportunity to help lead the development and implementation of extensive new user-facing products and features.
Teamwork is also paramount to this role. At KKH, designers and creatives work hand-in-hand with developers, who work hand in hand with our customer service team. Industry veterans work alongside recent college graduates, and all hands are on deck as we explore new, untapped areas of the interior design industry while also supporting the needs of our existing dealers and clients.
Job Description:
*Utilize the .NET web stack, including C#, ASP.NET, MVC, JavaScript, and MySQL, to develop and implement functionality and enhancements for our main website (www.kathykuohome.com), blog (www.kathykuohome.com/blog), and Designbar.com.
*Work alongside the product development team to design and create functionality for an optimal user shopping experience.
*Apply strong knowledge and hands-on experience in the analysis, design, and development of web services and applications within the .NET framework.
*Demonstrate the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines, with a clear understanding of prioritization.
*Exhibit excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills to interact effectively with team members, including those with a design focus and without a technical background.
*Be solutions-driven with a desire to increase efficiency through the consolidation of technical solutions, and proactively prioritize projects that enhance ROI and conversion rates.
*Coordinate and manage development and communications with offshore development team and US based team.
*Manage development time frames and schedules Work with designers on creating functionality considering UX and conversion.
*Manage all system integration (google shopping, bing, Amazon, Houzz,etc.)
*Provide user support Triage bugs and provide fixes.
*Coordinate and provide support for marketing partners.
*Understand and support adwords initiatives
*Research and provide suggestions on latest trends in web development and SEO.
Skill Requirements:
*At Least 5 Years of experience and knowledge of: C# / .Net Development ASP.Net web development experience Windows Server Javascript / Jquery CSS MySQL Server Databases MVC 5 Framework Systems architecture and application
*Proficient in .NET Core, ASP.NET MVC, and C#.
*Experience with front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and frameworks like Angular or React.
*Strong understanding of RESTful APIs and web services.
*Experience with SQL Server and other database technologies.
*Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
*Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD pipelines.
*Understanding of security best practices in e-commerce applications.
*Experience with microservices architecture.
*Knowledge of DevOps practices.
*Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
*Certifications in .NET technologies or cloud platforms.
Qualified individuals will be interviewed with a timed development test.
If you are all of the above, we would love to hear from you!
Culture and Values
The Kathy Kuo Home team members are design-obsessed, entrepreneurial-minded, and empathy-oriented individuals that seek to create more impact and beauty in the world of interiors. As one of the fastest growing online companies in the home and garden space, it is a fantastic time to join Kathy Kuo Home’s fast-paced, nimble, and creative team.
Core Values
We Employ Design Thinking #DesignWins | Design is how one approaches everything. Employing design thinking is employing first principles thinking. This applies not only to product or space design, but how we design our day, our work processes, and our organization
We are Limitless Learners | We are curious by nature and aim to be 1?tter every day by learning 1 new thing a day.
We Strive To Be Self-Aware | We are self-reflective and deeply curious about ourselves. We believe with a deep awareness of oneself, can one develop awareness for others.
We Play the Long Game | We have an infinite horizon for growth and lean into business decisions that have a long-lasting impact on brand growth
Core Principles
We have Deep Kindness and Respect for All | Our business model is supported by the relationships that we have with our customers, vendors, and shippers. We treat our team members, shippers, and vendors with the same spirit of kindness, willingness to collaborate, and respect for their needs.
We Lead with Empathy | When faced with hard choices, we lean into empathy and compassion first as our primary decision drivers. We proactively reach out to celebrate each other's success and buoy those that need us.
We Require Feedback | Giving and receiving feedback promotes a culture of self-awareness, growth, and humility, the foundations of strong inter-department connection.
We are Humble and Hungry | We operate with a startup mentality, scrappy and intentional with how we use our human and financial resources no matter what scale of business we are in.
We Audit the Details - Design and Service | We deeply audit all details and have hyper-awareness of process, cause, and effect and how this relates to our design and service quality output.
We Keep Calm / Grace Under Fire | We solve problems by being self-aware, open-minded, and accepting of different ideas and opinions and strive to be calm, reflective, and not defensive.

title: Property Manager Assistant
description:
Pivot Property Management manages over 100 doors in Springfield, Missouri as well as 600 truck parking spaces that are leased Daily, Weekly, and Monthly. 

The Property Manager Assistant will be responsible for remote tasks necessary for the leasing and management of real estate in Springfield, Missouri. Necessary skills include:

-Google Drive and Microsoft. Skilled in using Excel/Google Sheets/Word
-Experience and proficiency with Appfolio
-Quickbooks
-Good communication written and verbal
-Able to answer phones, problem solve, and direct to the right solution
-Research

Below is a list of responsibilities that will be required for the position.

-Inputting credits and debits into appfolio for multiple companies/properties. Experience with using Appfolio is a must.
-Drafting leases from a template with unique modifications as necessary
-Answering phones and determining how/when the situation with tenants should be resolved.
-Researching contractors in the market and sending out Requests for Proposals (RFP).
-Compiling multiple bids into google sheets for comparison
-Researching insurance carriers, getting quotes, and updating all insurance information in google drive.

This is a full-time position. Regular hours between noon and 8pm central standard time, Saturday-Wednesday would be preferable.

title: Excel Expert
description:
We are looking for an expert in EXCEL with more than 5 years of experience.

This job application is for candidates with Advanced or Expert level in excel, per description below.

Advanced Level:
Advanced users can utilize Excel for more sophisticated data analysis and automation, including:
- Complex Formulas: Using advanced functions like INDEX, MATCH, SUMPRODUCT, ARRAY formulas.
- Macros and VBA: Writing and using macros to automate repetitive tasks and writing basic VBA code.
- Advanced Data Analysis: Using tools like Power Query, Power Pivot, and advanced pivot table features.
- Advanced Charting: Creating dynamic and interactive charts.
- Data Models: Creating and managing data models for complex data analysis.
- Collaboration: Using Excel’s collaborative features, such as sharing workbooks and tracking changes.
- Advanced Sorting and Filtering: Using custom filters and advanced sorting techniques.

Expert Level:
- Expert users have a comprehensive mastery of Excel, capable of using it to its fullest potential, including:
- Advanced VBA Programming: Writing complex VBA code for extensive automation.
- Integration with Other Tools: Integrating Excel with other software and databases (e.g., SQL, Access).
- Dashboard Creation: Designing interactive dashboards for data visualization.
- Power BI Integration: Using Power BI tools for advanced data analysis and visualization.
- Advanced Data Management: Handling large datasets efficiently, using array formulas, and leveraging Excel's data management capabilities.
- Optimization and Performance: Improving the performance of Excel workbooks and managing resources effectively.

*Qualifications
- Applicant must have 2 computer monitors to work with.
- Must be available to work full time, business hours European time.

If you think you fit the description, please send an email with your CV to avishay@akpartnersgroup.com
and write in the subject your name and the words: "Excel Expert"

title: Data Entry & Analysis
description:
FULL TIME EXPERIENCED DATA ENTRY AND ANALYST. EASTERN TIME: 9am Eastern until 6pm Eastern
PERFECT SPOKEN ENGLISH WITN NO ACCENT & GREAT WRITING SKILLS REQUIRED.

If you have not taken Accent Reduction course, PLEASE DO NOT APPLY.

EXPERIENCE WITH AMAZON IS A HUGE PLUS...but not required.

Our clients are people, companies and brands that have products being sold in the US on Amazon. We protect brands from intellectual property infringement and help enforce their rights. We also help people that work for or formerly worked for Amazon. We are a New York based law firm where we all work on Eastern time zone.

We seek an experienced, energetic, self-motivated Data Entry and Analyst WITH GREAT English Writing and Computer Skills to train with and join our Brand Protection Team.

2. Experience with Data entry

I intend to travel to Manilla starting in May for team meetings every 60 days. We have hired people that were able to travel to Manila for the anticipated meetings.
5. Monthly Salary paid via Payoneer. You MUST have a Payoneer account and be able to be paid at the end of each month.
6. Work on EASTERN TIME. Please do not apply unless you can work on Eastern time zone. VERY IMPORTANT - YOU MUST HAVE A QUIET WORK PLACE. We have had issues where there are noises from roosters crowing in the background. When you are calling potential clients, you must have a quiet place from which to place the calls and to accept calls.
7. Great Written English.
8. You own high speed internet connection & Computer. You must be able to use our VOiP phone system and participate in multiple video conferences via Zoom.

Compensation:
1. Commensurate with Sales Experience and Spoken & Written English skills.
2. 13th Month Bonus payable one-half in June and one-half in December
3. 10 Paid Days Off per year after 6 months with the firm. Can be used 5 days, at most, 5 days at a time. The 10 days includes both sick and holiday time combined for a total of 10 days per year.

title: Experienced Funnel Builder & Conversion Rate Optimization Specialist
description:
Are you a data-driven expert with a passion for optimizing website performance?

Join us as a Funnel Builder and Conversion Rate Optimization Specialist and unlock the potential of our digital platforms! Utilize your expertise in data analysis, user behavior tracking, and A/B testing to identify opportunities, improve user experience, and drive conversions. From optimizing landing pages to refining customer journeys, your role will be pivotal in enhancing our digital success.

Be part of a dynamic team where your insights and experimentation drive continuous improvement and deliver measurable business growth.

We are looking for someone who gets things done and enjoys learning and tackling multiple tasks in a fast-paced stock and crypto startup environment.

Seeking Potential Management & Executive Level

We are seeking a funnel expert to join our team and design for maximum conversion. We are open to using Beehiiv and other applications to set up a funnel. You must be able to execute on the following:

- Craft irresistible offers to increase conversion rates.
- Set up pixel & tracking on our signup pages to track conversion rates.
- Set up surveys and segmentation.
- Set up all the draft emails to be used in automation.
- Set up sales and landing pages.
- Utilize webhooks and APIs.

Responsibilities: 

- Send out semi-automated daily newsletters. Review newsletters for AI mistakes before sending daily, Monday-Thursday.
- Schedule posts and screenshots on Twitter and Facebook groups with trade ideas.
- Improve email & landing page conversion rates.
- Improve automated sales & follow-up.
- Conduct research to understand user behavior and increase our conversion rate. Gather and act on feedback from customers.
- Develop and implement data-driven conversion rate optimization strategies to improve website performance and increase conversion rates.
- Monitor and analyze website and digital campaign performance using web analytics tools.
- Design and execute A/B and multivariate tests to optimize website elements, user flows, and conversion funnels.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement optimization strategies, including marketing, design, and development.
- Provide recommendations and insights based on data analysis to drive continuous improvement in conversion rates.
- Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in conversion rate optimization.
- Generate reports and present findings to stakeholders, highlighting key performance indicators and opportunities for optimization.
- Monitor and track the impact of optimization efforts on conversion rates and other relevant metrics.

Your Impact:

- Improved conversion rates across digital channels.
- Increased revenue and customer acquisition.
- Enhanced user experience and engagement.
- Data-driven insights and recommendations for further optimization.
- Effective collaboration and communication with cross-functional teams.

Essential Skills and Requirements:

- Proven experience as a Conversion Rate Optimization Specialist or similar role, including specific roles or projects related to funnel building, landing page, and video optimization.
- In-depth knowledge of web analytics tools such as Google Analytics.
- Proficiency in A/B testing, optimization techniques, and funnel-building tools (e.g., ClickFunnels, Unbounce, Leadpages, GoHighLevel, Kartra).
- Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
- Skills in creating compelling copy, visuals, and videos, with an understanding of persuasive design and user psychology.
- Background in digital marketing strategies, including SEO, PPC, email marketing, retargeting, and customer journey mapping.
- Basic coding knowledge (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) for customization, and experience with CRM and marketing automation platforms (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce).
- Analytical mindset for data-driven decision-making, creativity, problem-solving abilities, and strong communication skills to articulate strategies and results.
- A portfolio showcasing past work, including landing pages, videos, and funnel designs, with positive references from previous clients or employers attesting to skills and results.
- We are looking for a potential manager, so experience building out a team and systems is a plus!

Desired Characteristics:

- Creative and critical thinker, able to generate innovative ideas for optimization.
- Strong analytical aptitude to interpret data and derive actionable insights.
- Results-driven with a focus on achieving measurable outcomes.
- Inquisitive nature, constantly seeking opportunities for improvement.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
- Independent self-starter, capable of taking ownership of projects and driving them to completion.
- Flexible and adaptable, able to navigate changes and adapt strategies as needed.
- Optimistic and enthusiastic about achieving success.
- Collaborative mindset, valuing teamwork and open to input from others.
- Attention to detail to ensure accuracy in data analysis and reporting.

Pay

It’s not just you—finding a job seems impossible right now, even in America. This is your life-changing opportunity to earn a base pay with big bonuses! But you are competing with hundreds of other people for this opportunity.

Base Pay + Bonuses! 
Hours: 32 - 60, Depending on Pay

Affiliate Partners

If you’re really good at funnel hacking, you probably don’t need a job and could make tens of thousands of dollars as a commissioned affiliate. Ask us about our affiliate split and we will partner with you as one of our first affiliates.

How to Apply

We are seeking an experienced funnel builder and CRO with proven strategies to develop our funnel. We are experienced funnel builders, so you will have to have a tangible proven strategy you can work on day one.

Please send me a message titled: PLAN

In the description, layout why we should hire you:

- Offer: How would you sell WealthBranch?
- Offer: How are you going to bring in more money than we pay you every month?
- Action Plan: If we let you build the funnel, how long will it take, and how will you improve the conversion rate every week?
- Marketing: You will be focused on conversion rate, and a team member will focus on CTR, but do you have insights on how to get cheap impressions, leads, or eyeballs?
- Anything Else: We are open to partnering with anyone who has an idea on how they can bring in more value than we pay them in salary. If you have driven results in the past, let us know!

title: Manager: Outbound Sales & Business Development Specialist - HR Recruiter Focus
description:
Outbound Sales & Business Development Specialist - HR Recruiter Focus
Manager, Director, Trainee
----

“A cold email or direct message is the best one-sided trade; it costs you almost nothing and can gain you everything!”

Are you an experienced:

- Business Developer
- Affiliate Manager
- HR Recruiter
- Account Manager
- Sales Manager

Are you a proactive business development, sales, or recruiting expert who thrives in fast-paced environments? Do you excel at building connections through cold outreach? If so, we want to hear from you!

About the Role:

This role is perfect for someone who isn't afraid to take the first step in initiating contact and can handle high-volume outreach with precision and efficiency. You'll be responsible for sending out 100-300 targeted emails daily, combining automation with personalized, manual outreach to maximize engagement.

On any given day, you might be performing the following tasks or hiring and training someone else to do them:

- Sending emails to customers to gather feedback.
- Sending direct messages to employees to identify potential hires.
- Sending direct messages to potential affiliates to establish joint venture partnerships.
- Sending direct messages to potential podcasters and YouTubers to explore collaboration opportunities.

Key Responsibilities:

- High-Volume Outreach: Send 100-200 emails per day, using a mix of automated tools and manual efforts.
- Relationship Building: Craft engaging emails that not only capture attention but also foster friendly, long-term relationships.
- Email Automation: Set up and manage email automation sequences and responders to streamline communication.
- Feedback Collection: Reach out to customers for valuable feedback and insights.
- Recruiting Outreach: Direct message employees and potential candidates to identify top talent and fill key roles.
- Partnership Development: Engage potential affiliates and partners for joint ventures and collaborations.
- Content Creator Outreach: Connect with podcasters, YouTubers, and other influencers to explore collaboration opportunities.

What We’re Looking For:

- Fearless Communicator: You’re not afraid to reach out to anyone, no matter their position or background.
- Efficient & Organized: You can manage and execute hundreds of outreach efforts daily, without losing track of details.
- Tech-Savvy: Familiarity with email automation tools and CRM systems is a must.
- Results-Driven: Your focus is on achieving measurable outcomes, whether it's securing a meeting, partnership, or hire.

We are looking for a potential manager, so experience building out a team and systems is a plus!

If you’re ready to take on a dynamic role where every email you send could be the key to a new opportunity, apply today!

------------

How to Apply:

Do you know your stuff, can you teach us something we don’t know?

If you’re going to apply treat this as your first interview, direct message me answering the following questions:

What is your favorite cold email tool or 1:1 email tool to send bulk emails and why?

- MailShake
- Sales Forge
- Smarlead
- Instantly
- LeadLoft
- MailChimp, ActiveCampaign

What is your favorite CRM and why?

What is your favorite Lead Enrichment & Email Discovery database?

Do you have experience automating lead gathering and populating the CRM with potential leads for a team?

If we hire you on day one, what is your strategy for contacting more people per day?

How do you feel about the repetitive nature of direct messaging people?

Why should we hire or partner with you?

Introduce your self: https://forms.gle/jskLMgw2AsbZyQEv5

title: Senior Full Stack Developer
description:
Senior Full Stack Developer at JC Management
www.jcmanagement.com

JC Management is on the lookout for a Senior Full Stack Developer to enhance our software development team. This pivotal role involves working on both the front and back ends of our web applications, providing expertise in the full software development life cycle, from concept and design to testing and implementation. The ideal candidate will be a seasoned developer with a knack for designing, building, and maintaining efficient, reusable, and reliable code.
Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain scalable, robust, and high-quality software solutions.
Work on both the front-end and back-end portions of our applications, ensuring seamless integration and operation.
Collaborate with project managers, UX/UI designers, and other developers to plan, design, and launch new features.
Maintain and improve the performance of existing software.
Clearly and regularly communicate with management and technical support colleagues.
Test and deploy applications and systems.
Revise, update, refactor, and debug code.
Improve existing software by integrating new technologies and frameworks.
Mentor junior developers, fostering a culture of innovation and growth within the team.
Ensure software security by adhering to industry best practices in coding and architecture.

Minimum Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
At least 5 years of experience in full stack development.
Strong knowledge of front-end technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and modern libraries and frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue.js.
Proficient in server-side languages such as Node.js, Python, Ruby, Java, PHP, .NET, etc.
Experience with database technology such as MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB, and/or SQL Server.
Solid understanding of RESTful APIs, the web request-response cycle, and web services.
Experience with development tools such as Git, Mercurial, or SVN.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think algorithmically.

Preferred Skills

Experience with cloud services (AWS, Microsoft Azure) and web servers (Apache, Nginx).
Understanding of containerization and orchestration technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
Knowledge of code versioning tools and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.
Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.

What We Offer

A competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
Opportunities for professional development and career progression.
An inclusive and collaborative work environment.
Access to the latest tools and technology.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.

Application Process

To apply, please submit your resume, cover letter, and a portfolio or examples of recent projects that showcase your full stack development capabilities.

How to Apply: Interested candidates should email their application to [Insert Contact Information]. Your application should include a detailed resume, a cover letter that highlights your suitability for the role, and any relevant links to your portfolio or code repositories.

This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced developer who is ready to take on challenging projects and play a key role in driving the technology strategy at JC Management. We are excited to add a proactive and talented individual to our team.
